lines.value: the main campus of the university of zimbabwe is located in the mount pleasant suburb in northern harare
lines.name: English

lines.value: it forms the main portion of the block of land reserved for educational purposes between mount pleasant drive upper east road churchill avenue and teviotdale road
lines.name: English

lines.value: other facilities within this area include the zimbabwe schools examination council the ministry of education sports and culture audio visual centre and mount pleasant school
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to the academic buildings the main campus is host to sporting facilities all but two student residences and much of the staff housing
lines.name: English

lines.value: the college green located centrally to the academic buildings is a popular site for social events
lines.name: English

lines.value: about one third of the campus is a seasonal wetland unsuitable for construction and thus unused
lines.name: English

lines.value: the major satellite campus is the medical school campus at parirenyatwa hospital in central harare
lines.name: English

lines.value: it houses the college of health sciences
lines.name: English

lines.value: additional university properties within harare include blocks of flats for staff and student housing in avondale the avenues and mount pleasant
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university also owns a farm in teviotdale mazowe district north of harare and the university of zimbabwe lake kariba research station in the nyamhunga suburb of kariba
lines.name: English

lines.value: several of zimbabwe's universities started as colleges and satellite campuses of uz including bindura university of science education and chinhoyi university of technology
lines.name: English

lines.value: although uz has not generally featured in major international rankings such as the times higher education supplement qs world university rankings or the academic ranking of world universities the world universities ranking placed the university number 14 in africa in 2007 after various south african universities the american university in cairo and the university of dar es salaam and number 3549 out of 9760 accredited universities in the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 2008 uz had slid to number 17 in africa and number 4001 globally
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2010 according to university ranking by academic performance urap university of zimbabwe is the best university in zimbabwe and 1340th university in the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: the titular head of the university is the chancellor who is the president of zimbabwe
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university is governed by a university council comprising the university's chief officers representatives of the senate staff and students nominees of the minister of higher and tertiary education and representatives form various sectors of commerce and civil society
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chief executive of the university is the vice chancellor who is appointed by the chancellor after consultation with the minister of higher and tertiary education and the university council
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vice chancellor is assisted by one or more pro–vice-chancellors appointed by the university council with the approval of the minister of higher and tertiary education
lines.name: English

lines.value: the academic authority of the university is vested in the senate comprising the university's chief officers the deans of faculties all full professors the chairmen of departments and staff and student representatives
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university is divided into faculties managed by an executive dean and governed by a faculty board comprising all professors and lecturers
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are ten academic faculties
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university currently has one college the college of health sciences which incorporates the faculty of medicine
lines.name: English

lines.value: however many of zimbabwe's public universities started as colleges of the university of zimbabwe
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university has two trans disciplinary research institutes the institute of development studies ids and the institute of environmental studies ies
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are numerous education institutions affiliated to the university of zimbabwe including teacher training colleges and the school of social work
lines.name: English

lines.value: the academic year runs from august to june with graduation normally in september
lines.name: English

lines.value: as from february 2016 the university introduced a second intake,with an academic year that runs from february to december
lines.name: English

lines.value: the basic format of undergraduate learning at uz is lectures by professors or lecturers and tutorials by lecturers of teaching assistants
lines.name: English

lines.value: many programmes also have laboratory based practical work and field schools
lines.name: English

lines.value: tests and assignments on course content are graded for a theory coursework grade
lines.name: English

lines.value: practical work where applicable is graded for a practical coursework grade
lines.name: English

lines.value: theory and in some cases practical examinations are administered
lines.name: English

lines.value: the degree programmes follow the course unit model and in many programmes it is possible for students to select some of the courses from a range of options
lines.name: English

lines.value: honours degrees have a compulsory project course that the students must complete individually with different projects carried out by each student
lines.name: English

lines.value: the undergraduate programmes offered lead to bachelor bachelor honours and intercalated bachelor's degrees
lines.name: English

lines.value: registered bachelor's degree programmes are in arts business studies and computer science tourism and hospitality management education adult education science education nursing science science social work dental surgery medicine and surgery and veterinary science
lines.name: English

lines.value: registered undergraduate bachelor honours programmes are in agriculture agricultural engineering applied environmental science arts accountancy business studies law engineering mining engineering surveying medical laboratory sciences nursing science pharmacy occupational therapy physiotherapy science economics politics and administration psychology rural and urban planning and sociology
lines.name: English

lines.value: registered intercalated programmes are in anatomy human physiology veterinary anatomy veterinary physiology and veterinary biochemistry
lines.name: English

lines.value: postgraduate honours programmes also known as special honours programmes last are for one year duration and incorporate coursework examinations and a compulsory project module

lines.value: the first chief executive of the university was doctor william rollo who served as interim principal from 1953 to 1955
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first substantive principal was sir walter adams who served from 1955 to 1966 and was later director of the london school of economics
lines.name: English

lines.value: sir walter was succeeded by professor terence miller who lasted a mere two years as his political views brought him into conflict with the government
lines.name: English

lines.value: his successor professor robert craig later moderator of the general assembly of the church of scotland served from 1970 to 1980
lines.name: English

lines.value: professor leonard j lewis served as principal for the transition to zimbabwe's independence despite his somewhat controversial views on african education and politics
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was succeeded in 1981 by professor walter g kamba who became vice–chancellor when that post was created to replace that of principal
lines.name: English

lines.value: like prof miller prof kamba came into conflict with the government and he resigned in a controversial speech at the 1992 graduation ceremony citing government interference and threats to academic freedom
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was succeeded by professor gordon l chavunduka 1992–1996 who was followed by professor fw graham hill 1997–2002

lines.value: the incumbent vice–chancellor professor levi m nyagura has served since 2003

lines.value: sheela na gigs are figurative carvings of naked women displaying an exaggerated vulva
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are architectural grotesques found all over europe on churches castles and other buildings
lines.name: English

lines.value: the highest concentrations can be found in ireland great britain france and spain sometimes together with male figures
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the best examples may be found in the round tower at rattoo in county kerry ireland
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is a replica of the round tower sheela na gig in the county museum in tralee town
lines.name: English

lines.value: another well known example may be seen at kilpeck in herefordshire england
lines.name: English

lines.value: ireland has the greatest number of surviving sheela na gig carvings mcmahon and roberts cite 101 examples in ireland and 45 examples in britain
lines.name: English

lines.value: such carvings are said to ward off death and evil
lines.name: English

lines.value: other grotesques such as gargoyles and hunky punks were frequently part of church decorations all over europe
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is commonly said that their purpose was to keep evil spirits away see apotropaic magic
lines.name: English

lines.value: they often are positioned over doors or windows presumably to protect these openings
lines.name: English

lines.value: scholars disagree about the origins of the figures
lines.name: English

lines.value: james jerman and anthony weir believe that the sheela na gigs were first carved in france and spain in the 11th century the motif eventually reached britain and then ireland in the 12th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: jerman and weir's work was a continuation of research begun by jorgen andersen who wrote the witch on the wall 1977 the first serious book on sheela na gigs
lines.name: English

lines.value: eamonn kelly keeper of irish antiquities at the national museum of ireland in dublin draws attention to the distribution of sheela na gigs in ireland to support weir and jerman's theory almost all of the surviving in situ sheela na gigs are found in areas of anglo norman conquest 12th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: the areas that remained native irish have few sheela na gigs
lines.name: English

lines.value: weir and jerman also argue that their location on churches and the grotesque features of the figures by medieval standards suggests that they represented female lust as hideous and sinfully corrupting
lines.name: English

lines.value: another theory espoused by joanne mcmahon and jack roberts is that the carvings are remnants of a pre christian fertility or mother goddess religion
lines.name: English

lines.value: they note what they claim are differences in materials and styles of some sheela na gigs from their surrounding structures and noting that some are turned on their side to support the idea that they were incorporated from previous structures into early christian buildings
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition typical continental exhibitionist figures differ from those of irish sheela na gigs
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is a scarcity of male figures in ireland and the uk while the continental carvings are more likely to involve male figures
lines.name: English

lines.value: continental figures also are represented in more contortionist postures
lines.name: English

lines.value: the name was first published in the proceedings of the royal irish academy 1840 44 as a local name for a carving once present on a church gable wall in rochestown county tipperary ireland the name also was recorded in 1840 by john o'donovan an official of the ordnance survey of ireland referring to a figure on kiltinan castle county tipperary
lines.name: English

lines.value: scholars disagree about the origin and meaning of the name in ireland as it is not directly translatable into irish
lines.name: English

lines.value: alternative spellings of sheela may sometimes be encountered they include sheila sile and sila
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the oxford english dictionary it is derived from irish sile na gcioch meaning julia of the breasts
lines.name: English

lines.value: the name sean-na-gig was coined by jack roberts for the ithyphallic male counterpart of the sheela
lines.name: English

lines.value: while rare in ireland it is much more common on the continent
lines.name: English

lines.value: jorgen andersen writes that the name is an irish phrase originally either sighle na gcioch meaning the old hag of the breasts or sile ina giob meaning sheila from the irish sile the irish form of the anglo norman name cecile or cecilia on her hunkers
lines.name: English

lines.value: dinneen also gives sile na gcioc stating it is a stone fetish representing a woman supposed to give fertility gnly [= generally] thought to have been introduced by the normans other researchers have questioned these interpretations few sheela na gigs are shown with breasts and expressed doubt about the linguistic connection between ina giob and na gig
lines.name: English

lines.value: the phrase sheela na gig was said to be a term for a hag or old woman
lines.name: English

lines.value: barbara freitag devotes a chapter to the etymology of the name in her book sheela na gigs unravelling an enigma
lines.name: English

lines.value: she documents references earlier than 1840 including a royal navy ship sheela na gig and an 18th-century dance called the sheela na gig
lines.name: English

lines.value: irish slip jig first published as the irish pot stick c.1758 appears as shilling a gig in brysson's a curious collection of favourite tunes 1791 and sheela na gigg in hime's 48 original irish dances c.1795
lines.name: English

lines.value: these are the oldest recorded references to the name but do not apply to the architectural figures
lines.name: English

lines.value: the royal navy's records indicate the name refers to an irish female sprite
lines.name: English

lines.value: freitag discovered that gig was a northern english slang word for a woman's genitals
lines.name: English

lines.value: a similar word in modern irish slang gigh pronounced ) also exists further confusing the possible origin of the name
lines.name: English

lines.value: weir and jerman use the name sheela for the figure because it had entered popular usage they also call figures of both sexes exhibitionist
lines.name: English

lines.value: they cite andersen's second chapter as a good discussion of the name
lines.name: English

lines.value: andersen says there is no evidence that sheela na gig was ever a popular name for the figures when they were created
lines.name: English

lines.value: it arose during the mid 19th century where popular understanding of the characteristics of a sheela were vague and people were wary of its apparent rudeness
lines.name: English

lines.value: an earlier reference to the dubious nature of the name is made by hc lawlor in an article in man vol
lines.name: English

lines.value: 31 jan 1931 royal anthropological institute of great britain and ireland in which he writes the term sheela na gig has no etymological meaning and is an absurd name andersen weir and jerman and freitag all dismiss the name as being modern and somewhat arbitrary
lines.name: English

lines.value: the oldest recorded name for one of the figures is the idol which relates to the binstead figure on the isle of wight
lines.name: English

lines.value: this name was mentioned by r worsley in his the history of the isle of wight 1781 and noted also by j albin in a new correct and much improved history of the isle of wight 1795 andersen page 11
lines.name: English

lines.value: the name the idol also was applied to a now lost figure in lusk ireland and was recorded as being in use around 1783

lines.value: much of the disagreement among scholars about these figures focuses on determining exactly what they are meant to represent and no theory explains all the figures
lines.name: English

lines.value: a popular hypothesis is that sheela na gigs represent a pagan goddess but academics believe the situation was more complex with multiple interpretations and roles for the female character as spiritual traditions changed over time
lines.name: English

lines.value: the goddess in question usually is identified as celtic the hag like cailleach figure of irish and scottish mythology
lines.name: English

lines.value: margaret murray proposed this as did anne ross who wrote in her essay the divine hag of the pagan celts i would like to suggest that in their earliest iconographic form they do in fact portray the territorial or war goddess in her hag like aspect mircea eliade's the encyclopedia of religion 1993 draws parallels between the sheela na gig and the ancient irish myth of the goddess who granted kingship
lines.name: English

lines.value: she would appear as a lustful hag and most men would refuse her advances except for one man who accepted
lines.name: English

lines.value: when he slept with her she was transformed into a beautiful maiden who would confer royalty onto him and bless his reign
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are additional variants of this common northern european motif see loathly lady
lines.name: English

lines.value: andersen devotes a chapter to this theory entitled pagan or medieval while suggesting possible pagan influences on irish sheela na gigs he firmly places them in a medieval context
lines.name: English

lines.value: he argues that pagan origins are less likely than influence from the continent during the medieval period what can be said against it is that it is less easily proved and can be less easily illustrated than the possible continental french origin for the motif discussed in earlier chapters the witch on the wall p 95
lines.name: English

lines.value: weir and jerman explore the possible influence of the baubo figurine on the motif but they acknowledge that the link is tenuous
lines.name: English

lines.value: they write it makes for very interesting speculation but the amount of evidence is not large
lines.name: English

lines.value: freitag explores possible celtic pagan origins but finds little to suggest a link ...in particular the notion of the divine hag being a portrayal of the ur sheela has to be firmly dismissed as wayward conjecture sheela na gigs unravelling an enigma page 41
lines.name: English

lines.value: although scholars have used evidence to reject the theory it is popularly held
lines.name: English

lines.value: this hypothesis usually is combined with the goddess explanation for the figures discussed above
lines.name: English

lines.value: barbara freitag suggests that the figures were used in a fertility context and associates them with birthing stones
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is folkloric evidence of at least some of the sheela na gigs being used in this manner with the figures being loaned out to women in labour
lines.name: English

lines.value: other figures have wedding traditions associated with them
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to margaret murray the figure in oxford at the church of st michael at the north gate has an associated tradition of being shown to brides on their wedding day
lines.name: English

lines.value: this theory does not cover all the figures some are thin with their ribs showing and thin breasts which do not signal fertility

lines.value: others are plump and are shown in a sexual context with a partner as at whittlesford

lines.value: theresa oakley and alex woodcock recently discovered an exhibitionist couple at devizes who seem to represent fertility

lines.value: the faces of some figures are striated indicating scarring or tattoos

lines.value: weir notes that a close examination of the figures reveals features that do not fit a fertility function
lines.name: English

lines.value: weir and jerman suggested that the sheela na gigs served to warn against lust
lines.name: English

lines.value: they see the figures as a religious warning against sins of the flesh
lines.name: English

lines.value: exhibitionist figures of all types male female and bestial are frequently found in the company of images of beasts devouring people and other hellish images
lines.name: English

lines.value: these images they argue were used as a means of religious instruction to a largely illiterate populace
lines.name: English

lines.value: as part of this interpretation they explore a continental origin for the figures
lines.name: English

lines.value: andersen first suggested this origin and weir and jerman continued and expanded this line of inquiry
lines.name: English

lines.value: they argue that the motif migrated from the continent via the pilgrim routes to and from santiago de compostella
lines.name: English

lines.value: freitag argues against this pilgrim sculptors took notes of what they had seen on the route and ended up carving their own interpretations of the motifs
lines.name: English

lines.value: eventually the exhibitionist motif was carried to ireland and britain

lines.value: this theory seems to accommodate many of the religious figures but relates less well to some of the secular ones
lines.name: English

lines.value: images carved on castles would not seem to be serving a religious purpose

lines.value: the figure at haddon hall appears on a stable although this may have been moved from elsewhere

lines.value: the theory does not cover all the figures
lines.name: English

lines.value: andersen and weir and jerman think the figures may also have been used as protection against evil
lines.name: English

lines.value: this would cover the use of the figures on structures such as castles
lines.name: English

lines.value: they served an apotropaic function designed to ward off evil

lines.value: in ireland some of the figures were called the evil eye stones which supported their theory

lines.value: there is also some folkloric evidence of anasyrma being used by women lifting up their dresses to curse evil spirits

lines.value: feminists have adopted the image as an icon with feminist authors viewing the sexuality of the sheela na gig in a more positive light an empowering figure

lines.value: reverence for female sexuality and vulvas can be seen in the art of judy chicago's the dinner party and the vagina monologues by eve ensler
lines.name: English

lines.value: in wide-open to mirth and wonder luz mar gonzalez-arias argues that the creative reimagining of this medieval female figure can encourage contemporary women to stop perceiving their own corporeality as a heavy awkward and shameful burden of guilt
lines.name: English

lines.value: irish writer molly mullin's essay representations of history irish feminism and the politics of difference makes the point that the image of the sheela na gig has almost become emblematic of irish feminism as a force for hope and change scholar georgia rhoades argues that for many contemporary feminists the gesture of the sheela's unapologetic sexual display is a message about her body its power and significance a gesture of rebellion against misogyny rather than an endorsement of it
lines.name: English

lines.value: as noted above ireland has the greatest number of known sheela na gigs

lines.value: at one time they were mistakenly thought to be a uniquely irish practice however scholars realized that the sheela na gig motif could be found all over western and central europe

lines.value: accurate numbers of figures are difficult to reach as the interpretation of what is a sheela na gig will vary among scholars

lines.value: for example freitag omits the rochester figure from her list while weir and jerman include it

lines.value: with renewed interest in the topic scholars have recently identified previously unknown figures so more could be discovered

lines.value: the warlord is a sword and sorcery character appearing in comic books published by the american company dc comics

lines.value: the comic's protagonist travis morgan obtains the name warlord as he fights for the freedom of the people of skartaris

lines.value: the character the warlord debuted in 1st issue special 8 cover-dated nov 1975

lines.value: the decision to give the warlord his own series had already been made by the time his 1st issue special debut went into production

lines.value: he starred in the warlord 1 feb 1976 followed by an eight month hiatus after issue 2 picking up again with 3 nov 1976

lines.value: the title lasted 133 issues until winter 1988

lines.value: vietnam war veteran sr 71 pilot travis morgan passed through a hole in the earth's crust while flying over the north pole in 1969 and landed in the underground world of skartaris a place strongly reminiscent of edgar rice burroughs's pellucidar

lines.value: there travis wielding his .44 automag pistol and joined by shamballah's princess later queen tara a scantily dressed savage became the warlord and fought villains such as the evil sorcerer deimos as well as various kings

lines.value: the royal saxon tomb in prittlewell is a high status anglo saxon tomb excavated at prittlewell north of southend on sea in the english county of essex
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the autumn of 2003 in preparation for a road widening scheme an archaeological survey was carried out on a plot of land to the north east of priory park in prittlewell
lines.name: English

lines.value: earlier excavations had indicated saxon burials in the area however it was not expected that such a significant find could be made
lines.name: English

lines.value: the archaeologists were lucky in the placement of their trench and uncovered a set of saxon remains
lines.name: English

lines.value: archaeologists from the museum of london archaeology service under the supervision of atkins ltd excavated the site and discovered an undisturbed 7th century chamber grave beneath a mound
lines.name: English

lines.value: they described it as the most spectacular discovery of its kind made during the past 60 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: the quality and preservation of the prittlewell chamber tomb has led to inevitable comparisons with the sutton hoo ship burial and associated graves
lines.name: English

lines.value: the artefacts found were of a quality that it is likely that prittlewell was a tomb of one of the kings of essex and the discovery of golden foil crosses indicates that the inhabitant was an early christian
lines.name: English

lines.value: about 110 objects were lifted by conservators in two phases over a period of ten days
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of the objects were block lifted together with the soil that they were embedded in
lines.name: English

lines.value: the final lift was completed on 20 december 2003 with final defining of the chamber walls and back filling continuing for three days after
lines.name: English

lines.value: the body had been laid in a wooden coffin with two small gold foil crosses one over each eye
lines.name: English

lines.value: one opinion was that he had been laid in the coffin by christians and that the coffin had been then buried by pagans
lines.name: English

lines.value: the acidic sandy soil had completely dissolved the body's bones and any other bone in the tomb but some pieces of human teeth were found but too far affected by decay for dna to be found in them
lines.name: English

lines.value: excavation demonstrated the tomb to be a deep formerly walled room full of objects of copper gold silver and iron and the chamber had gradually collapsed and filled with soil as its containing wooden supports decayed
lines.name: English

lines.value: these finds included an anglo saxon hanging bowl decorated with inlaid escutcheons and a cruciform arrangement of applied strips a folding stool three stave built tubs or buckets with iron bands a sword and a lyre the last one of the most complete found in britain
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tomb itself is square the largest chambered tomb ever discovered in england
lines.name: English

lines.value: the design of the lyre was reconstructed from soil impressions and surviving metal pieces
lines.name: English

lines.value: there was evidence that it had been repaired at least once
lines.name: English

lines.value: a copy of it was made in yew wood and was played to accompany a funeral song sung for king saberht in anglo saxon and english in st mary's church in southend
lines.name: English

lines.value: the inventory of grave goods is comparable to one found in a burial at taplow in 1883 and though the overall collection is less sumptuous than that from the ship burial in mound 1 at sutton hoo many individual objects are closely comparable and of similar quality
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example there is a hollow gold belt buckle but much plainer than that from sutton hoo but the lyres drinking vessels and copper alloy shoe buckles are very similar
lines.name: English

lines.value: as at sutton hoo the best hope for closely dating the burial is the merovingian gold coins however the dating of these is a complicated matter based on their metallic content rather than the design and information stamped on them
lines.name: English

lines.value: research continues on this as on other aspects of the find but the evidence initially suggests a date in the period 600-650 or 600-630
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is an object identified as a standard as at sutton hoo but of a different type and there is a folding stool of a type often seen in royal portraits in early medieval manuscripts like a curule seat that is a unique find in england and was probably imported
lines.name: English

lines.value: the quality of the locally made objects and the presence of imported luxury items such as the coptic bowl and flagon appear to point to a royal burial
lines.name: English

lines.value: the most obvious candidates are either saberht of essex died 616 ad or his gransdon sigeberht ii of essex murdered 653 ad who are the two east saxon kings known to have converted to christianity during this period
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the evidence points to an early seventh century date saberht is considered more likely
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is however also possible that the occupant is of some other wealthy and powerful individual whose identity has gone unrecorded
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the meantime the occupant has acquired the popular nickname of the king of bling in reference to the rich grave goods
lines.name: English

lines.value: southend borough council faced criticism due to plans to continue with the already controversial road widening scheme covering the site
lines.name: English

lines.value: the council has however promised to find a home for the finds in order to keep them in the borough and it has been suggested that a new gallery will be created at southend museum for their display
lines.name: English

lines.value: the project was the winner of the developer funded archaeology award as part of the british archaeological awards for 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: from september 2005 to july 2009 the site was occupied by a road protest camp known locally as camp bling
lines.name: English

lines.value: funding for a reduced road scheme at cuckoo corner includes provision for post excavation work at the tomb
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2004 a rededication of the king's tomb was hosted by the bishop of chelmsford and a large celebration event took place attended by over 5000 people in the area
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tomb was de dedicated in a ceremony held at prittlewell priory supported by 85 local churches and voluntary organisations entitled discover the king
lines.name: English

lines.value: the event patron was local mp sir teddy taylor and the chair of the organising event was jonathan ullmer
lines.name: English

lines.value: a special episode of channel 4's time team archaeological series entitled king of bling and devoted to prittlewell was first broadcast on 13 june 2005 and replayed later
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to the princely tomb there is other archaeological evidence of early anglo saxon occupation of prittlewell
lines.name: English

lines.value: a 1923 excavation in priory crescent revealed a 6th or 7th century anglo saxon cemetery which may have extended into what is now priory park
lines.name: English

lines.value: the parish church a short distance to the south contains a remnant of a 7th-century church
lines.name: English

lines.value: the julius maximilian university of wurzburg also referred to as the university of wurzburg in german julius maximilians universitat wurzburg is a public research university in wurzburg germany
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university of wurzburg is one of the oldest institutions of higher learning in germany having been founded in 1402
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university initially had a brief run and was closed in 1415
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was reopened in 1582 on the initiative of julius echter von mespelbrunn
lines.name: English

lines.value: today the university is named for julius echter von mespelbrunn and maximilian joseph
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university of wurzburg is part of the u15 group of researchintensive german universities
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university is also a member of the coimbra group
lines.name: English

lines.value: its official name is julius maximilians universitat wurzburg or julius maximilian university of wurzburg but it is commonly referred to as the university of wurzburg
lines.name: English

lines.value: this name is taken from julius echter von mespelbrunn prince bishop of wurzburg who reestablished the university in 1582 and prince elector maximilian joseph the prince under whom secularization occurred at the start of the 19th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university's central administration foreign student office and several research institutes are located within the area of the old town while the new liberal arts campus with its modern library overlooks the city from the east
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university today enrolls approximately 29000 students out of which more than 1000 come from other countries
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the university was first founded in 1402 it was short lived
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was attributed to the lack of financial security and the instability of the age
lines.name: English

lines.value: johannes trithemius well known humanist and learned abbot of the scottish monastery of st jacob held the then dissolute student lifestyle responsible for the premature decline of the city's first university
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the annales hirsaugiensis chronologia mystica of 1506 he cites bathing love brawling gambling inebriation squabbling and general pandemonium as greatly impeding the academic achievement in wurzburg
lines.name: English

lines.value: evidence of this is provided by the fatal stabbing of the university's first chancellor johann zantfurt in 1413 by a scholar's unruly assistant or famulus evidently the result of these very influences
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite egloffstein's thwarted first attempt at founding a university the city still boasts one of the oldest universities in the german speaking world almost on a par with prague 1348 vienna 1365 heidelberg 1386 cologne 1388 and erfurt 1392
lines.name: English

lines.value: a university in wurzburg was refounded more than 150 years later
lines.name: English

lines.value: a second founding by prince bishop julius echter von mespelbrunn 1545-1617 in 1582 offered the institution guaranteed autonomous self government
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university was fiercely roman catholic and initially considered a bastion of catholicism in the face of protestantism words also used in the university charter which prevented all non catholics from graduating from or receiving tenure at the alma julia
lines.name: English

lines.value: echter intended it as a tool of counter reformation
lines.name: English

lines.value: over a century would pass before the university opened its doors to non catholics in keeping with the spirit of enlightenment encouraged by prince bishop friedrich karl von schonborn's newly formulated students charter of 1734
lines.name: English

lines.value: the resultant increase in religious tolerance even enabled the summoning and subsequent appointment of the famous physician karl kaspar von siebold under schonborn's successor adam friedrich von seinsheim
lines.name: English

lines.value: shortly after his arrival in 1769 protestant medical students were permitted to study for their doctorates at the university
lines.name: English

lines.value: wurzburg's increasing secularisation as a bishopric and its eventual surrender to bavarian rule at the beginning of the 19th century resulted in the loss of the university's roman catholic character
lines.name: English

lines.value: the end of the city's status as a grand duchy under ferdinand of toscana in 1814 heralded the alma julia's ideological transition to the non denominational establishment which endures to this day
lines.name: English

lines.value: this new inclusiveness towards professors and students alike was instrumental in the resultant upturn in all areas of research and education in the 19th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: since then the university has borne the name of its second and most influential founder officially known as the julius maximilians universitat of bavaria
lines.name: English

lines.value: the many medical accomplishments associated with the university from the mid to late 19th century were inextricably linked with achievements in the affiliated field of natural science notably by schwab the eminent botanist semper the zoologist wislicenus the celebrated chemist and boveri the biologist
lines.name: English

lines.value: their progress culminated in the discovery of x rays by physicist wilhelm conrad rontgen first winner of the nobel prize for physics in 1895
lines.name: English

lines.value: rontgen's discovery which he dubbed a new kind of ray is regarded as the university's greatest intellectual achievement and simultaneously a scientific development of huge global import
lines.name: English

lines.value: rontgen's successors namely wilhelm wien johannes stark and the chemists emil fischer and eduard buchner also number among the succession of nobel prize winners to lecture at the university a tradition which endures in the modern day example of klaus von klitzing
lines.name: English

lines.value: after world war ii the free state of bavaria invested a fortune in the rebuilding and renovation of the university buildings which had been severely damaged by allied bombing
lines.name: English

lines.value: restoration of echter's old university current home to the faculty of law continues today
lines.name: English

lines.value: the eventual rebuilding of the neubaukirche neubau church also affiliated to the legal faculty and almost razed to the ground in 1945 marked the end of the city's extensive reconstruction process
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1970 it was decided that the church one of the most important examples of 16th century vaulted architecture in southern germany should fulfill a dual function as a place of worship and as the university banquet assembly and concert hall
lines.name: English

lines.value: echter's heart removed for safekeeping during the war has once again found its place in the church he designed fulfilling a request made during his lifetime
lines.name: English

lines.value: * university of wurzburg

lines.value: lauren helen graham born march 16 1967 is an american actress and author
lines.name: English

lines.value: she is best known for her roles as lorelai gilmore on the television series gilmore girls 2000-2007 for which she received nominations for screen actors guild golden globe and satellite awards and as sarah braverman on the nbc television drama parenthood 2010-2015
lines.name: English

lines.value: graham's film work includes roles in sweet november 2001 bad santa 2003 the pacifier 2005 because i said so 2007 and evan almighty 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: she published her debut novel with ballantine books in 2013 someday someday maybe
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2016 graham reprised her role as lorelai gilmore on netflix's reunion miniseries gilmore girls a year in the life and published a memoir talking as fast as i can
lines.name: English

lines.value: lauren helen graham was born on march 16 1967 in honolulu hawaii
lines.name: English

lines.value: her mother donna grant was a fashion buyer and her father lawrence graham is a candy industry lobbyist who has been president of the national confectioners association
lines.name: English

lines.value: graham was raised in her father's catholic faith her maternal grandfather was a baptist minister she is of irish english and scottish descent
lines.name: English

lines.value: when graham's father worked for the agency for international development in vietnam lauren lived for a few years in japan her mother also grew up there as the daughter of a missionary
lines.name: English

lines.value: graham was five years old when her parents divorced and she moved to alexandria virginia with her father who became a congressional staffer while her mother left to pursue an artistic career and lived in london until her death at age 61
lines.name: English

lines.value: graham also spent a few of her childhood years in southampton new york
lines.name: English

lines.value: graham has a half sister and a half brother from her father's second marriage and a british half sister shade grant from her mother's second marriage who works at a talent agency
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a girl graham rode horses competitively but soon switched to acting honing her talent at langley high school where she took part in the drill team and graduated in 1984
lines.name: English

lines.value: she earned her actor's equity card in 1988 after two years in summer stock at the barn theatre in augusta michigan
lines.name: English

lines.value: graham went to new york university but then transferred to barnard college
lines.name: English

lines.value: she graduated from barnard college of columbia university in 1988 with a bachelor of arts degree in english literature
lines.name: English

lines.value: after moving to texas in 1992 graham earned a master of fine arts degree in acting performance from southern methodist university
lines.name: English

lines.value: after completing her education graham moved back to new york city where she earned her living as a waitress and tutor teaching sat test prep for the princeton review
lines.name: English

lines.value: while she aspired to become an actress she made publicity appearances wearing the costume of striker the dog mascot of the us based 1994 fifa world cup
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1995 she relocated to hollywood
lines.name: English

lines.value: she appeared in various commercials for products such as dimetapp and lean cuisine and hosted free preview weekends on the movie channel
lines.name: English

lines.value: between 1996 and 1997 graham became a regular guest star on several hit nbc shows
lines.name: English

lines.value: she played a graduate student who caught the eye of dick on 3rd rock from the sun richard's overly optimistic girlfriend on caroline in the city and jerry's speed dial ranking girlfriend on seinfeld
lines.name: English

lines.value: she played a hollywood producer who had a love interest in rey curtis and a three part episode of law & order where she acted opposite scott cohen who would later play one of graham's love interests max medina on gilmore girls
lines.name: English

lines.value: she also portrayed an antagonizing but friendship starved efficiency expert on newsradio
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to her many guest starring and co starring roles on prime time television graham starred in four failed sitcoms including townies with molly ringwald and jenna elfman the short lived sitcom lush life with lori petty and karyn parsons and myob which was burned off by nbc in the summer months before the premiere of gilmore girls
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2000 graham landed her breakthrough role as lorelai gilmore on gilmore girls a witty thirty something raising her teenage daughter in small town connecticut
lines.name: English

lines.value: graham said she felt really connected to the material and the script for the series resonated with her due to its complexities to me this was one of the first times that i looked at something and i was like it's serious and it's funny
lines.name: English

lines.value: it's deep and it's light especially then i had never seen before for her work she received a nomination for best actress in a television series drama at the 2002 golden globe awards and nominations at the 2001 and 2002 sag awards
lines.name: English

lines.value: beginning with season 7 episode to whom it may concern and continuing throughout the rest of the season graham served as a producer on gilmore girls
lines.name: English

lines.value: tv guide reported that she received the position in an attempt to persuade her to sign for an eighth season
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the series end graham wanted to move on
lines.name: English

lines.value: i didn't feel we had anything without our creators she reflected
lines.name: English

lines.value: graham returned to her guest starring roots when she portrayed herself in two episodes of nbc's studio 60 on the sunset strip
lines.name: English

lines.value: graham has also appeared in the second season of bravo's celebrity poker showdown co hosted by dave foley of newsradio

lines.value: after winning her preliminary match she came in second to another former newsradio star maura tierney in the championship game

lines.value: graham's film roles encompass several nyu student films and multiple major studio releases including sweet november bad santa the pacifier because i said so and evan almighty.graham has said that she enjoys playing in short films and acting in the williamstown theatre festival

lines.value: she has performed in numerous short films including the 15-minute-long gnome

lines.value: in 2007 graham signed a seven figure development deal with nbc in one of the year's richest tv talent pacts

lines.value: graham has also worked as the voice over announcer in national advertising for kellogg's various special k products in 2007 and for american express ads in 2008 introducing the plum card which is targeted towards small and growing businesses

lines.value: graham made her broadway debut as miss adelaide in the revival of guys and dolls which began preview performances at the nederlander theatre on february 5 2009 and opened on march 1 2009
