lines.name: English

lines.value: urien often referred to as urien rheged or uriens was a late 6th-century king of rheged an early british kingdom of the hen ogledd northern england and southern scotland
lines.name: English

lines.value: his power and his victories including the battles of gwen ystrad and alt clut ford are celebrated in the praise poems to him by taliesin preserved in the book of taliesin
lines.name: English

lines.value: he became the king urien of gorre of later arthurian legend and his son owain mab urien was later known as ywain
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the genealogies urien was the son of cynfarch oer son of meirchion gul son of gorwst son of cenau son of coel hen king cole the first recorded post roman military leader in the area of hadrian's wall
lines.name: English

lines.value: he fought against the rulers of the anglian kingdom of bernicia modern northumbria
lines.name: English

lines.value: an anglian noble ida had occupied metcauld around the middle of the 6th century and begun to raid the mainland
lines.name: English

lines.value: urien joined with other northern kings rhydderch hael the generous of strathclyde and two other descendants of coel gwallog mab llaenog and morgant bwlch
lines.name: English

lines.value: they defeated the angles and besieged them on lindisfarne but according to the historia brittonum urien was assassinated at the behest of morgant bwlch who was jealous of his power
lines.name: English

lines.value: a man called llofan llaf difo is said to have killed him
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the welsh triads calls the death of urien one of the three unfortunate assassinations and another lists him as one of the three great battle leaders of britain
lines.name: English

lines.value: he had four sons named owain rhiwallon rhun and pasgen
lines.name: English

lines.value: the eldest of them succeeded him
lines.name: English

lines.value: urien remained a popular figure in wales over the centuries and he and his son owain were incorporated into arthurian legend as it spread from britain to continental europe
lines.name: English

lines.value: his kingdom was eventually transferred to the mythical land of gore and kings lot of lothian and auguselus of scotland are sometimes said to be his brothers
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the reign of uther pendragon he marries arthur's sister often morgan le fay but sometimes another sister is named
lines.name: English

lines.value: he like the kings of several other lands initially opposes arthur's accession to the throne after uther's death
lines.name: English

lines.value: urien and the others rebel against the young monarch but upon their defeat the rebels become arthur's allies and vassals
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the legends his marriage to morgan is not portrayed as a happy one however as in one story morgan plots to take excalibur kill urien and arthur and place herself and her lover accolon on the throne
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is always said to be the father of ywain owain and many texts give him a second son ywain the bastard fathered on his seneschal's wife
lines.name: English

lines.value: welsh tradition attributes to him a daughter named morfydd
lines.name: English

lines.value: thomas malory sometimes spells his name urience which has led some e.g alfred tennyson to identify him with king rience
lines.name: English

lines.value: urien is mentioned in the 20th century welsh awdl yr arwr by hedd wyn
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is also one of the key characters in melvyn bragg's novel credo 1996 a celebration of the celtic tradition and its fight against the northumbrian and roman catholic incursions
lines.name: English

lines.value: he appears as uryens in john boorman's film excalibur depicted as an enemy lord who becomes arthur's ally and is the one to knight him
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is a minor character in mary stewart's merlin trilogy
lines.name: English

lines.value: langford is a city located on southern vancouver island in the province of british columbia canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: langford is one of the 13 component municipalities of greater victoria and is within the capital regional district
lines.name: English

lines.value: langford was incorporated in 1992 and has a population of over 34000 people
lines.name: English

lines.value: its municipal neighbours are colwood to the southeast highlands to the north metchosin to the southwest and view royal to the northeast
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city of langford was officially incorporated on december 8 1992
lines.name: English

lines.value: langford boasts a long history of european settlement dating back to 1851 when captain edward langford established one of the four hudson's bay company farms in the victoria area
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the early 1860s the region of langford experienced a short lived gold rush in what is now goldstream provincial park
lines.name: English

lines.value: the area was once a favourite recreation destination for thousands of victorians in the late 1800s day trippers travelled via railway to the popular country resort goldstream house hotel hunters built their lodges on the shores of the lakes near the mountains and a summer colony of the well to do city folk relaxed and socialized at langford lake
lines.name: English

lines.value: in recent times the region has become the fastest growing little city on vancouver island with big retail stores and new residential developments and the expanding suburban town of langford became a city in 2003
lines.name: English

lines.value: the motto of langford is golden in setting determined in spirit containing a reference to the natural beauty of the city of langford specifically goldstream provincial park and a comment on the community's drive to enhance langford's special character and future
lines.name: English

lines.value: langford is the fastest growing community in british columbia attracting new residents from all over greater victoria the lower mainland and alberta due to new housing developments strong real estate market and affordability desirable temperate climate with warm dry summers and mild wet winters ample amenities as the commercial centre of west shore and year long recreational activities
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the pace of development and some planning decisions particularly big box retail developments and aggressive suburban sprawl have attracted criticism some would argue the city is expanding too quickly at the expense of natural surroundings and existing infrastructure and city council is too pro development the community continues to grow rapidly and attract residents
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is the largest municipality in the western communities and third largest in the capital regional district after saanich and victoria
lines.name: English

lines.value: activities in langford include shopping at the many retail stores at millstream village and westshore town centre formerly canwest mall with its 55 stores and services including major department grocery and retail chain stores as well as a seven screen cineplex movie theatre
lines.name: English

lines.value: many city parks are attractions in langford including city centre park with a family friendly entertainment zone including a family fun park and veterans memorial park located in the heart of downtown and at the center a cenotaph commemorating the men and women of the canadian forces who have given their lives in the line of duty and where langford holds its yearly remembrance day ceremony
lines.name: English

lines.value: community events include many parades seasonal goldstream farmer's market the summer festival and luxton fair
lines.name: English

lines.value: rugby canada has its headquarters in langford practicing at westhills stadium
lines.name: English

lines.value: a new $30 million ymca/ywca aquatic centre opened in may 2016 acclaimed by the mayor to be the biggest project in the history of langford and features multiple pools recreation facilities and a new library
lines.name: English

lines.value: visitors can also participate in go karting and mini golfing and watch stock car racing and demolition derby at western speedway
lines.name: English

lines.value: langford is home to world class golf courses including bear mountain resort on skirt mountain
lines.name: English

lines.value: the large community resort offers a system of mountain bike trails as the training centre for the canadian national mountain bike team and is currently planning the development of clay tennis courts for the national team and a professional disc golf course
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are many lakes in the area for fishing swimming and non motorized boating including langford glen and florence lake
lines.name: English

lines.value: langford is known for the many nature parks and network of trails popular with hikers and walkers alike including mill hill park mount wells thetis lake regional park and the challenging high elevation mount finlayson
lines.name: English

lines.value: cyclists enjoy the picturesque multi use galloping goose trail formerly a railway line that moves through urban and rural parts of langford and is used as a commuter trail to downtown victoria taking only approximately 45 minutes on bicycle starting at goldstream village using the wale road connector quicker than rush hour traffic
lines.name: English

lines.value: goldstream provincial park is a large nature reserve home to old growth trees waterfalls estuaries and an education visitor centre nature house offering many visitor activities such as camping picnicking hiking and wildlife watching like eagle viewing during the annual salmon run
lines.name: English

lines.value: langford is the urban core of the five suburban municipalities comprising the region of west shore for a combined population of about 75000
lines.name: English

lines.value: notable physical features of langford include the three prominent lakes langford lake glen lake and florence lake and the humpback reservoir several peaks such as mount finlayson and mount wells and the notable goldstream provincial park
lines.name: English

lines.value: the malahat drive part of the trans canada highway begins in langford and the galloping goose regional trail and the e and n railway go through the city
lines.name: English

lines.value: langford enjoys a temperate climate with mild temperatures and distinct dry and rainy seasons
lines.name: English

lines.value: most built up areas in langford are on basalt bedrock while lower lying regions of the langford plain from langford lake to royal bay are glacial till and happy valley and goldstream river valley are on deep sand of the colwood delta
lines.name: English

lines.value: old growth forestlands were once abundant in langford but urban sprawl threaten natural habitat including coastal douglas fir western red cedar arbutus trees and garry oak ecosystems
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last remaining pockets of arbutus groves and garry oak meadows are unique to southern vancouver island and only about five percent of the ecosystems remain in their natural state landing on the province's list of species at risk
lines.name: English

lines.value: the unique mediterranean characteristics of the island's climate supports the garry oak ecosystem and are common in its natural habitat in the few remaining undeveloped areas of langford and are under threat due to rapid growth high density subdivisions and urbanization
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2015 langford had an estimated population of approximately 34000
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is experiencing tremendous growth and had a population of 22459 people in the 2006 census which was an increase of 19.2% from the 2001 census count
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has a growth rate of approximately 5% annually
lines.name: English

lines.value: the population is expected to double again by 2026
lines.name: English

lines.value: the median household income in 2005 for langford was $60199 which is slightly higher than the british columbia provincial average of $52709
lines.name: English

lines.value: langford is a part of the school district 62 sooke with approximately 10000 students in sooke port renfrew metchosin colwood and langford
lines.name: English

lines.value: ten of the 25 schools are in langford including one middle school and one high school
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2015 two new state of the art high schools were built to a leed gold standard to replace the 65-year-old belmont high school lake front belmont secondary school the largest on vancouver island in langford with a capacity of 1200-students and the ocean side royal bay secondary school in colwood with 800 students
lines.name: English

lines.value: both high schools are already overcapacity due to rapidly expanding region
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is also the westshore centre for learning and training and the lighthouse christian academy which serves kindergarten to grade 12
lines.name: English

lines.value: langford is an evolving community outgrowing its reputation as the rough redneck suburban outskirts of victoria
lines.name: English

lines.value: mayor stew young and city council have proposed major upkeep and tidiness of the central downtown district and the city has received numerous community showcase awards including the provincial communities in bloom award
lines.name: English

lines.value: council were winners of the 2014 golden scissors award by the canadian federation of independent business cfib for their simple but transformative initiative of making business licenses permanent
lines.name: English

lines.value: langford council has also set up a pioneering program for developing affordable housing requiring developers of new subdivisions within the city of langford to build one affordable home for every 10 single family lots subdivided
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first canadian community based on the leed environmental standard westhills was developed near langford lake
lines.name: English

lines.value: langford has three fire stations with a mix of 60 volunteer and career members
lines.name: English

lines.value: every year in mid december langford hosts an annual fire truck parade which features decorated emergency vehicles from around the province
lines.name: English

lines.value: the region is policed by the west shore detachment of the royal canadian mounted police
lines.name: English

lines.value: additionally langford is also home to the central bc ambulance 911 call centre located at 2764 leigh rd which provides 911 dispatch services to the entire vancouver island and surrounding islands
lines.name: English

lines.value: felix sharshenbayevich kulov russian фennkc wapwehbaebny kynob kyrgyz фennkc wapwehbaebny wapwehban yyny kynob feliks sarsenbayevic sarsenbay uulu kulov born 29 october 1948 is a kyrgyz politician who was prime minister of kyrgyzstan from 2005 to 2007 following the tulip revolution
lines.name: English

lines.value: he first served from 1 september 2005 until he resigned on 19 december 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: president kurmanbek bakiyev reappointed him acting prime minister the same day but parliamentary opposition meant bakiyev's attempts to renominate kulov in january 2007 were unsuccessful and on 29 january the assembly's members approved a replacement
lines.name: English

lines.value: kulov cofounded and leads ar namys a political party and chairs the people's congress an electoral alliance to which ar namys belongs
lines.name: English

lines.value: kulov was born in frunze present-day bishkek and initially trained as a policeman
lines.name: English

lines.value: between 1978 and 1998 he held various posts in the kyrgyz government including minister of the interior minister for national security and governor of chuy province
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1992 1993 he was vice president in which position he oversaw the launch of the kyrgyz currency the som
lines.name: English

lines.value: however he was forced to resign following a scandal over missing gold reserves
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1998 to 1999 kulov served as mayor of bishkek becoming a popular politician in the city
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1999 he participated in the formation of ar namys becoming its first leader
lines.name: English

lines.value: in february 2000 he announced his intention to run as a member of the supreme council
lines.name: English

lines.value: kyrgyz police arrested him a month later for corruption
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 22 january 2001 a military court found him guilty and sentenced him to seven years in prison
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was cleared of all charges against him in 2005 and in 2010 the un human rights committee found several civil rights violations in his detention and trial
lines.name: English

lines.value: on march 24 2005 kulov was released during the kyrgyz revolution the tulip revolution and appointed as co ordinator of law enforcement and security services effectively the kyrgyz head of security by acting president and prime minister kurmanbek bakiyev
lines.name: English

lines.value: he resigned this position on march 30 saying that he had restored order
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 6 april a special working group of the kyrgyz supreme court was formed to review kulov's earlier prosecution and convictions and by 11 april he had been cleared of all charges
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this time period kulov was accused by politician and alleged crime figure ryspek akmatbayev of organising the murder of his brother tynychbek leading to a national wave of protests
lines.name: English

lines.value: kulov initially announced his intention to stand as a candidate for president in the elections scheduled for 10 july
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was unclear at first whether language would be a barrier to his election the president is required by law to be fluent in the kyrgyz language and in common with many from the north of the country kulov's native tongue is russian
lines.name: English

lines.value: the issue became moot however when he withdrew his candidacy in mid may pledging his support to bakiyev
lines.name: English

lines.value: at that time he was also appointed acting first deputy prime minister
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was already expected to be appointed as prime minister by the elected president
lines.name: English

lines.value: bakiyev won the election in july
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was sworn in on 11 august
lines.name: English

lines.value: he appointed kulov acting prime minister
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 1 september 2005 kulov was confirmed as prime minister by the kyrgyz parliament by a vote of 55 to 8
lines.name: English

lines.value: kulov served as prime minister until 19 december 2006 when he resigned automatically triggering the dismissal of his cabinet per the constitution
lines.name: English

lines.value: president bakiyev immediately appointed him acting prime minister
lines.name: English

lines.value: bakiyev appointed kulov prime minister again in mid january 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: parliamentarians voted 39 to 23 against the confirmation of kulov 15 votes short the minimum for confirmation on 18 january 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: opposition parliamentarian azimbek beknazarov told kulov prior to the vote i may be wrong but i believe your nomination will be rejected
lines.name: English

lines.value: be brave and admit that you cannot perform your duties of prime minister
lines.name: English

lines.value: admit that you have been unable to do so for the past year and a half
lines.name: English

lines.value: i think it would be better if you refused [to be reappointed]
lines.name: English

lines.value: be a man president bakiyev renominated kulov the next day since the new constitution permits the same candidate to be presented three times
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kyrgyz parliament's constitution committee ruled on 22 january 2007 that bakiyev could not renominate kulov because it violated the constitution
lines.name: English

lines.value: committee chairman iskhak masaliyev told bakiyev to nominate someone else
lines.name: English

lines.value: myrza kaparov bakiyev's envoy to the parliament disagreed telling parliamentarians we must also refer to the constitutional law on government which says that the president has the right to submit the candidacy three times
lines.name: English

lines.value: if the jorgorku kenesh rejects his choice three times you know all the consequences
lines.name: English

lines.value: everything is clearly written in this law after kulov's nomination failed for the second time on 26 january the president nominated agriculture minister azim isabekov a close associate of his and former deputy head of the presidential administration on 26 january 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: in february kulov joined an opposition group the united front for a worthy future for kyrgyzstan which called for an early presidential election
lines.name: English

lines.value: as leader of the group he has also supported the idea of establishing a confederation with russia
lines.name: English

lines.value: anti bakiyev protests from april 11 to april 19 2007 culminated with clashes between the protesters and the police and kulov was questioned in connection with the clashes on april 21 after initially refusing to appear for questioning on the previous day
lines.name: English

lines.value: kulov blamed the authorities for the clashes
lines.name: English

lines.value: on august 1 2007 kulov was charged with creating public disorder in connection with the clashes
lines.name: English

lines.value: gohad is a city and a municipality in bhind district in the indian state of madhya pradesh
lines.name: English

lines.value: a town of historical importance it is situated close to the city of gwalior.it is known as jatwara also
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to alexander cunningham and william crooke people of village bamrauli near agra settled the town of gohad in 1505 and constructed the gohad fort
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bamraulia villagers had been forced to leave bamraulia by a satrap of firuz shah tughluq
lines.name: English

lines.value: gohad developed into an important jat state and was later captured by the marathas
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ranas of gohad signed a treaty with the british and helped them capture gwalior and gohad from the marathas
lines.name: English

lines.value: the british kept gwalior and handed control of gohad to the jats in 1804
lines.name: English

lines.value: however gohad was handed over to the marathas under a revised treaty dated 22 november 1805 between the marathas and the british
lines.name: English

lines.value: as compensation for gohad the jat ruler rana kirat singh was given dhaulpur badi and rajakheda
lines.name: English

lines.value: kirat singh moved to dhaulpur in december 1805
lines.name: English

lines.value: the historically important rulers among the above were bhim singh 1707-1756 and chhatar singh 1757-1785
lines.name: English

lines.value: they occupied the gwalior fort twice bhim singh from 1740 to 1756 and chhatra singh from 1780 to 1783
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this period they constructed several monuments within gwalior fort including the cenotaph of bhim singh
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1783 gwalior fort was captured by marathas under mahadji shinde gohad was handed over to marathas under a revised treaty dated 22 november 1805 between marathas and britishers
lines.name: English

lines.value: under this treaty gohad ruler rana kirat singh was given dhaulpur badi and rajakheda in exchange with gohad
lines.name: English

lines.value: rana kirat singh moved to dhaulpur in december 1805
lines.name: English

lines.value: sindhias could take over gohad on 27 february 1806 with the help of britishers
lines.name: English

lines.value: thus the rana jat rulers of bamraulia gotra ruled gohad for 300 years from 1505-1805
lines.name: English

lines.value: rana singhandev ii had founded gohad fort but maharaja bhim singh rana maharaja chhatra singh and maharaja kirat singh did the major construction works
lines.name: English

lines.value: the site of gohad fort was selected strategically on the vaisli river where it takes a circular turn
lines.name: English

lines.value: the river was dug and flow of river was extended up to the fort to take a semi circular shape
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fort has 7 gates named after the villages to which they face and the way they lead to
lines.name: English

lines.value: these are itayli in south barthara in west gohadi in northwest birkhari in northeast kathwan in east kharaua in southeast and saraswati
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fort was protected with four lines of defence
lines.name: English

lines.value: the jat rulers of gohad constructed several other monuments including forts palaces temples wells and gardens which are of archaeological and historical importance
lines.name: English

lines.value: these include the gohad fort itayali darwaja chhatra mahal shish mahal satbhanwar laxman tal rani guru temple laxman temple and modi ki haveli to mention a few
lines.name: English

lines.value: george platt lynes april 15 1907 - december 6 1955 was an american fashion and commercial photographer who worked in the 1930s and 1940s
lines.name: English

lines.value: he produced some photographs featuring many gay artists and writers from the 1940s that were acquired by the kinsey institute after his death in 1955
lines.name: English

lines.value: born in east orange new jersey to adelaide sparkman and joseph russell lynes died 1932
lines.name: English

lines.value: his younger brother was joseph russell lynes jr 1910-1991
lines.name: English

lines.value: lynes spent his childhood in new jersey but attended the berkshire school in massachusetts where he was a classmate of lincoln kirstein 1907-1996
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was sent to paris in 1925 with the idea of better preparing him for college
lines.name: English

lines.value: his life was forever changed by the circle of friends that he would meet there including gertrude stein glenway wescott monroe wheeler
lines.name: English

lines.value: he attended yale university in 1926 but dropped out after a year to move to new york city
lines.name: English

lines.value: he returned to the united states with the idea of a literary career and he even opened a bookstore in englewood new jersey in 1927
lines.name: English

lines.value: he first became interested in photography not with the idea of a career but to take photographs of his friends and display them in his bookstore
lines.name: English

lines.value: returning to france the next year in the company of wescott and wheeler he traveled around europe for the next several years always with his camera at hand
lines.name: English

lines.value: he developed close friendships within a larger circle of artists including jean cocteau and julien levy the art dealer and critic
lines.name: English

lines.value: levy would exhibit his photographs in his gallery in new york city in 1932 and lynes would open his studio there that same year
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was soon receiving commissions from harper's bazaar town & country and vogue including a cover with perhaps the first supermodel lisa fonssagrives
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1935 he was asked to document the principal dancers and productions of kirstein's and george balanchine's newly founded american ballet company now the new york city ballet
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was also most notably friends with katherine anne porter author of the novel ship of fools with whom he often enjoyed photographing wearing elaborate evening gowns and occasionally reenacting shakespeare
lines.name: English

lines.value: during his lifetime lynes amassed a substantial body of work involving nude and homoerotic photography
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1930s he began taking nudes of friends performers and models including a young yul brynner although these remained private unknown and unpublished for years
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the following two decades lynes continued his work in this area passionately albeit privately
lines.name: English

lines.value: the depth and commitment he had in photographing the male nude from the start of his career to the end was astonishing
lines.name: English

lines.value: there was absolutely no commercial impulse involved - he couldn't exhibit it he couldn't publish it allen ellenzweig art and photography critic who wrote the introduction to george platt lynes the male nudes published in 2011 by rizzoli
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the late 1940s lynes became acquainted with dr alfred kinsey and his institute in bloomington indiana
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinsey took an interest in lynes work as he was researching homosexuality in america at the time
lines.name: English

lines.value: a large number of lynes nude and homoerotic works were left to the kinsey institute after his death in 1955
lines.name: English

lines.value: the body of work residing at the kinsey institute remained largely unknown until it was made public and published later
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kinsey collection represents one of the largest single collections of lynes's work
lines.name: English

lines.value: for over ten years lynes had a love affair with both monroe wheeler the curator and glenway wescott 1901-1987 the writer
lines.name: English

lines.value: he later got together with his studio assistant and after he died in world war ii lynes moved in with the younger brother of the assistant
lines.name: English

lines.value: by may 1955 lynes had been diagnosed terminally ill with lung cancer
lines.name: English

lines.value: he closed his studio and was reported to have destroyed much of his print and negative archives particularly his male nudes
lines.name: English

lines.value: however it is now known that he had transferred many of these works to the kinsey institute
lines.name: English

lines.value: he clearly was concerned that this work which he considered his greatest achievement as a photographer should not be dispersed or destroyed...we have to remember the time period we're talking about america during the post war red scare after a final trip to europe lynes returned to new york city where he died in 1955 while living with his brother and his family
lines.name: English

lines.value: southernplayalisticadillacmuzik is the 1994 debut album of american hip hop duo outkast
lines.name: English

lines.value: after befriending each other in 1992 rappers andre 3000 and big boi pursued recording music as a duo and worked with production team organized noize which led to their signing to laface records
lines.name: English

lines.value: the album was produced by the team and recorded at the dungeon darp studios purple dragon bosstown and doppler studios in atlanta
lines.name: English

lines.value: a southern hip hop record southernplayalisticadillacmuzik features live instrumentation in its hip hop production and musical elements from funk and soul genres
lines.name: English

lines.value: wanting to make a statement about urban life as an african american in the south outkast wrote and recorded the album as teenagers and addressed coming of age topics with the album's songs
lines.name: English

lines.value: they also incorporated repetitive hooks and southern slang in their lyrics
lines.name: English

lines.value: southernplayalisticadillacmuzik was released by laface on april 26 1994 and peaked at number 20 on the billboard 200 eventually being certified platinum in the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: the record received positive reviews from critics and helped distinguish southern hip hop as a credible hip hop scene amid east coast and west coast hip hop's market dominance at the time
lines.name: English

lines.value: the album has since been viewed by music journalists as an important release in both hip hop and atlanta's music scene
lines.name: English

lines.value: andre 3000 and big boi met in 1992 at the lenox square shopping mall when they were both 16 years old
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two lived in the east point section of atlanta and attended tri cities high school
lines.name: English

lines.value: during school they participated in rap battles in the cafeteria
lines.name: English

lines.value: andre 3000 dropped out of high school at age 17 and worked a series of jobs before he and big boi formed a group called 2 shades deep he returned to obtain his ged at a night school following the release of southernplayalisticadillacmuzik
lines.name: English

lines.value: they briefly dabbled in street hustling to save up for recording money
lines.name: English

lines.value: the duo also spent time at their friend rico wade's basement recording studio known as the dungeon with wade's production team organized noize and future members of hip hop group goodie mob
lines.name: English

lines.value: outkast recorded demos at the studio and organized noize member ray murray helped big boi whose strength lay in songwriting develop his rapping skills
lines.name: English

lines.value: after several local productions the team was hired by laface records to produce remixes to songs from tlc's 1992 album ooooooohhh on the tlc tip
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team had andre 3000 and big boi rap over them which led to a record deal from laface for both organized noize and outkast
lines.name: English

lines.value: the commercial success of arrested development's 1992 alternative hip hop single tennessee also encouraged laface to sign outkast the label's first hip hop act
lines.name: English

lines.value: after receiving a $15000 advance from laface in 1993 outkast started recording the album at the dungeon
lines.name: English

lines.value: the studio featured mostly secondhand recording equipment
lines.name: English

lines.value: recording sessions also took place at bosstown dallas austin's darp studios doppler studios and purple dragon in atlanta
lines.name: English

lines.value: located in midtown atlanta bosstown developed a sentimental value for outkast who later bought the studio in 1999 and renamed it stankonia after their fourth studio album
lines.name: English

lines.value: throughout the album's recording the duo refined their artistry and drew on ideas from funk contemporary r&b and soul music
lines.name: English

lines.value: andre 3000 also smoked marijuana during the sessions
lines.name: English

lines.value: they recorded over 30 songs for the album
lines.name: English

lines.value: southernplayalisticadillacmuzik was produced entirely by organized noize which was made up of rico wade ray murray and sleepy brown
lines.name: English

lines.value: production team organized noize utilized live instrumentation on the album emphasizing musical instruments including bass keyboards guitar and organ over conventional hip hop techniques such as djing and sampling
lines.name: English

lines.value: they viewed that the feel of live instruments made the music sound more authentic and immediate
lines.name: English

lines.value: with their production the team sought an organic celebratory "" vibe as brown later recalled we wanted atlanta brothers to be proud of where they were from
lines.name: English

lines.value: brown also sung vocals for several tracks
lines.name: English

lines.value: along with organized noize other members of the dungeon family worked on the album including goodie mob mr dj debra killings and society of soul
lines.name: English

lines.value: the album was mixed at sound on sound in new york city bosstown darp studios tree sound and studio lacoco in atlanta
lines.name: English

lines.value: a southern hip hop album southernplayalisticadillacmuzik incorporates analog elements such as southern styled guitar licks languid soul melodies and mellow 1970s funk grooves
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also features digital hip hop production elements such as programmed snare beats booty bass elements including roland tr 808 clave rhythms and old school hip hop elements including e mu sp 1200 styled drums and turntable scratches
lines.name: English

lines.value: music writers characterize the album's music and beats as clanky and mechanical
lines.name: English

lines.value: roni sarig of rolling stone comments that the music shows clear debts to east coast bohos like the native tongues and a west coast level of attention to live instruments and smooth irresistible melodies
lines.name: English

lines.value: in oliver wang's classic material music writer tony green delineates the album's release at the tail end of a second hip hop golden age a two year period 1993-94 that spawned wu tang's enter the wu tang 36 chambers snoop dogg's doggystyle de la soul's buhloone mindstate nas's illmatic and a tribe called quest's midnight marauders and comments that like many albums released during that period southernplayalistic alluded to its roots while clearing the way for a new direction that used the peach cobbler soul funk of the organized noize production crew as a starting point with the album outkast wanted to make a statement about urban life as an african american in the south particularly atlanta
lines.name: English

lines.value: written when they were teenagers much of the album addresses coming of age topics and has themes of self empowerment and reflections on life in the new south
lines.name: English

lines.value: encyclopedia of popular music editor colin larkin writes that the album compris[es] tales of the streets of their local east point and decatur neighbourhoods
lines.name: English

lines.value: the album's segue tracks illustrate southern life
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lyrics incorporate tongue twisters triplet rhyme schemes repetitive vocal hooks southern slang such as the recurring phrase ain't no thang but a chicken wing repeated throughout ain't no thang
lines.name: English

lines.value: the duo also intersperse their lyrics with references to classic cars marijuana use s and players which big boi defines as somebody who can take care of they business in the game the game of life
lines.name: English

lines.value: his flow is frenetic and has a rapid delivery while andre 3000 raps in a more relaxed cadence with staccato rhymes and occasionally sings on the album
lines.name: English

lines.value: writer martin c strong views that both rappers lyrical panache on the album has an ebb and flow similar to kool keith and del the funky homosapien
lines.name: English

lines.value: the song call of da wild discusses the temptation to drop out of school while git up git out encourages teenagers to follow their passions be productive and stop using drugs
lines.name: English

lines.value: the latter is an intertextual track that mixes themes of consciousness and political awareness with images of violence sex drugs and gangsta culture
lines.name: English

lines.value: it features guest rapper cee lo green exploring perspectives of both and maternal figure
lines.name: English

lines.value: funky ride has no rappers and is instead sung by r&b group society of soul a side project of organized noize
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has an extended guitar solo and musical similarities to funkadelic and bootsy collins
lines.name: English

lines.value: crumbling erb explores themes of hedonism and addresses black on black violence and the negative effect it has on african american culture there's only so much time left in this crazy world i'm just crumbling niggas killing niggas they don't understand it's the master plan i'm just crumbling erb
lines.name: English

lines.value: the album's lead single player's ball was released on november 19 1993 originally intended as a christmas release it featured the sound of sleigh bells in its original mix but it was removed once the single began receiving more airplay
lines.name: English

lines.value: the single received its highest exposure in february 1994 with heavy airplay and promotion including a music video directed by sean puffy combs
lines.name: English

lines.value: combs had received a copy of the single from laface founder la reid and invited outkast to new york to perform as an opening act for the notorious big by march the single had sold 500000 copies and risen to number one on the billboard hot rap singles topping the chart for six weeks
lines.name: English

lines.value: the single's popularity among young black college students during freaknik increased its sales and helped it break into the top 40 a rare achievement for a hip hop song at the time
lines.name: English

lines.value: player's ball spent 20 weeks and peaked at number 37 on the billboard hot 100
lines.name: English

lines.value: on may 12 1994 it was certified gold by the recording industry association of america riaa in the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: the single helped create buzz for the album
lines.name: English

lines.value: neither of the album's next two singles performed as well
lines.name: English

lines.value: the title track was released in july and it reached number 74 on the billboard hot 100 in august
lines.name: English

lines.value: its music video was directed by f gary gray
lines.name: English

lines.value: git up git out was released in october
lines.name: English

lines.value: it only charted on the billboard hot r&b singles peaking at number 59
lines.name: English

lines.value: southernplayalisticadillacmuzik was released by laface records on april 26 1994
lines.name: English

lines.value: it peaked at number 20 on the us billboard 200 on may 14
lines.name: English

lines.value: the album ultimately spent 26 weeks on the chart
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also reached number three on the billboard top r&b albums remaining on the chart for 50 weeks
lines.name: English

lines.value: by june the album had sold 500000 copies
lines.name: English

lines.value: the album's sales increased after outkast's appearance at the 1995 source awards in january
lines.name: English

lines.value: on april 5 1995 southernplayalisticadillacmuzik was certified platinum by the riaa for shipments of one million copies in the us
lines.name: English

lines.value: by august it had sold 715000 copies according to nielsen soundscan
lines.name: English

lines.value: the album was reissued by laface in september 1998
lines.name: English

lines.value: southernplayalisticadillacmuzik was well received by contemporary critics
lines.name: English

lines.value: james bernard of entertainment weekly preferred the album's southern hip hop over arrested development's suspiciously peppy idealized version of down home and stated it's about time someone told today's weed obsessed youth to get up get out and get something/don't spend all your time trying to get high dennis hunt of the los angeles times cited git up git out as the album's highlight and commended the duo's sauntering hard core tales of the hood writing that they bristle with clever humor and sharp insights rather than rage rob marriott of the source complimented the duo's organic p funk influence and praised their lyrics honesty commenting that while their rhyme style may swing a little too close to hiero for my comfort what really makes this album so listenable is that truthfulness reigns however robert christgau gave the album a dud rating in his consumer guide for the village voice
lines.name: English

lines.value: christgau remarked on outkast's early albums in a later consumer guide article stating if dre and big boi were addressing real real life situations on southernplayalisticadillacmuzik or atliens they were drawling too for any to tell in a retrospective review of the album steve juon of rapreviews called it a stellar debut album but noted some musical flaws including the monotonous bassline and chorus of d.e.e.p the out of place funky ride and the album's segue tracks
lines.name: English

lines.value: music journalist peter shapiro found its production rich deep and detailed but never as seductive or crowd pleasing as dr dre's and commended the album as a melancholy depiction of the game that never shied away from its consequences
lines.name: English

lines.value: although he found occasional dull and mediocre spots allmusic editor stanton swihart called the album an extremely strong showing and praised the duo's inventive sense of rhyme flow and mixture of lyrical acuity goofball humor southern drawl funky timing and legitimate offbeat personalities
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite its success southernplayalisticadillacmuzik had some detractors including hip hop tastemakers who were unaccustomed to the album's style
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the 1995 source awards outkast won in the best newcomer category but were booed upon taking the stage and delivering their acceptance speech big boi managed to deliver his shout outs while andre 3000 was nervous and only said the south got something to say the latter recalled how the album was received by some listeners people thought that the south basically only had bass music
lines.name: English

lines.value: at first people were looking at us like um i don't know hip hop magnate russell simmons reacted negatively to the album at the time but later expressed regret and said of the album in retrospect at the time i didn't understand their music it sounds so different from what i was used to that i foolishly claim[ed] that they weren't hip hop the same way people didn't understand sucker mcs a decade earlier i didn't understand that instead of operating outside of hip hop outkast was actually expanding hip hop
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were offering one of the most honest expressions and expression so honest that it went completely over my head at first after the album was certified platinum laface records gave outkast more creative control and advanced money for their 1996 follow up album atliens
lines.name: English

lines.value: after acquiring their own recording studio the duo immediately started working on new material and assimilated themselves with music recording and studio equipment as they sought to become more ambitious artists and less dependent on other producers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two also became more accustomed to playing live particularly big boi and andre 3000 significantly changed his lifestyle as he adopted a more eccentric fashion sense became a vegetarian and stopped smoking marijuana
lines.name: English

lines.value: the album's success also opened up more opportunities for organized noize who subsequently worked on tlc's crazysexycool 1994
lines.name: English

lines.value: the organized noize produced hit waterfalls became a massive success and earned the production team enough clout with laface to endorse goodie mob to the label
lines.name: English

lines.value: organized noize produced goodie mob's acclaimed 1995 debut soul food and continued their crossover into r&b production including work on curtis mayfield's 1997 album new world order
lines.name: English

lines.value: southernplayalisticadillacmuzik was a seminal album for southern hip hop
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the early 1990s the scene was largely discredited by the rest of the hip hop community as misogynistic and inferior to other scenes particularly east coast and west coast hip hop
lines.name: English

lines.value: those scenes dominated the hip hop market and acts from other regional scenes were often produced by either east coast or west coast producers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the album offered an artistically credible alternative both musically and lyrically to those regional scenes and was produced by an atlanta based production team
lines.name: English

lines.value: music journalist t hasan johnson notes outkast's first submission to the music industry as significant for how they broke from the binary production options split by california and new york artists viewing that their decision to boast their region and a native production team signaled a break from the conventional split between east and west hip hop aesthetics and openly demonstrated that the south could produce street certified quality music nicole hodges persley cites its release as a critical moment in hip hop and writes that it marked a break in bicoastal hip hop sound
lines.name: English

lines.value: the album presaged hip hop's dirty south aesthetic which later achieved mainstream recognition
lines.name: English

lines.value: its smooth musical style drawing on soul and funk musical traditions and the duo's clever lyrics helped define southern hip hop's sound which influenced acts like goodie mob joi and bubba sparxxx
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the new rolling stone album guide rolling stone journalist roni sarig writes that the album marked a coming out for a region that would dominate hip hop by the decade's end commenting that with it outkast helped define a new stream of hip hop that would rejuvenate the music in the late 90s and early 2000s allmusic's stanton swihart comments that no one sounded like outkast in 1994 and that the album showcased organized noize as it began forging one of the most distinctive production sounds in popular music in the 90s
lines.name: English

lines.value: southernplayalisticadillacmuzik was also a significant release during the burgeoning hotlanta music scene
lines.name: English

lines.value: the scene started as a black music revival in atlanta during the late 1980s and developed with the success of laface records and the national attention received by atlanta based recording artists and producers such as toni braxton kris kross jermaine dupri and babyface
lines.name: English

lines.value: the album offered realistic depictions of the city and veered from the afrocentric themes of arrested development and dupri's mainstream stylings
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was named the third best album of 1994 in ego trips list of hip hop's 25 greatest albums by year 1980 98
lines.name: English

lines.value: vibe included it as one of the 150 essential albums of the vibe era 1992-2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: the magazine also included the album on their 2004 list of 51 essential albums that represent a generation a sound and in many cases a movement writing that [outkast] determined the south had something to say and after emerging form the dungeon production lab they said it all sometimes sang it all pointedly funkdafied and putting on absolutely no east coast pretense
lines.name: English

lines.value: oneota is a designation archaeologists use to refer to a cultural complex that existed in the eastern plains and great lakes area of what is now the united states from around ad 900 to around 1650 or 1700
lines.name: English

lines.value: based on classification defined in gordon willey and philip phillips 1958 book method and theory in american archaeology the oneota culture belongs to formative stage
lines.name: English

lines.value: the culture is believed to have transitioned into various macro siouan cultures of the protohistoric and historic times such as the ioway
lines.name: English

lines.value: a long accepted ancestry to the ho chunk has yet to be conclusively demonstrated
lines.name: English

lines.value: oneota is considered a major component of upper mississippian culture
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is characterized by globular shell tempered pottery that is often coarse in fibre
lines.name: English

lines.value: pieces often had a spherical body short necks and or a flat lip
lines.name: English

lines.value: sometimes the vessels had strap handles
lines.name: English

lines.value: decoration includes wavy and zigzag lines often in parallel
lines.name: English

lines.value: most decoration was done on the top half of the vessel
lines.name: English

lines.value: analytically the culture has been broken down into various stages or horizons
lines.name: English

lines.value: generally accepted are the following the oneota diet included corn beans and squash wild rice nuts fish deer and bison varying according to the region and locale
lines.name: English

lines.value: relationships with middle mississippian were present but are not yet clearly understood
lines.name: English

lines.value: whether oneota developed in situ out of late woodland cultures was invasive was the result of influence from proto-)middle mississippian peoples or was some mix of these is not clear
lines.name: English

lines.value: curt weibull 19 august 1886 &ndash 10 november 1991 was a swedish historian educator and author
lines.name: English

lines.value: curt hugo johannes weibull was born in lund sweden
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a member of the noted swedish weibull family
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was the son of history professor martin weibull 1835-1902 and the brother of lauritz weibull alexander weibull julius oscar elof weibull and carl gustaf weibull
lines.name: English

lines.value: he and his brothers attended the university of lund
lines.name: English

lines.value: curt weibull was a professor of history at gothenburg university from 1927 1953 and its president from 1936 to 1946
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1928 he and his brother lauritz weibull founded the periodical scandia
lines.name: English

lines.value: together they are known for having introduced a critical theory of history in swedish historical research inspired by german historian leopold von ranke
lines.name: English

lines.value: weibull was an important mentor to historian erik lonnroth who further developed the methods to evaluate sources
lines.name: English

lines.value: his most important and acclaimed work is a criticism regarding the interpretation and the ahistoricism of the gesta danorum by the 12th century danish historian saxo grammaticus
lines.name: English

lines.value: this piece was called saxo
lines.name: English

lines.value: kritiska undersokningar i danmarks historia fran sven estridsens dod till canute vi saxo
lines.name: English

lines.value: critical studies in denmark's history from sven estriden's death to canute vi and was rather controversial at the time as it revealed the vague foundations of denmark's older history of the time
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1991 when he was 105 his last work was published an article in a book celebrating the 100th anniversary of gothenburg university
lines.name: English

lines.value: that probably makes him the oldest historian in the world to have a new study published while still alive
lines.name: English

lines.value: an anecdote tells that when a danish historian was counter criticizing parts of weibull's treatise on saxo grammaticus in a doctoral dissertation believing he was dead since this was after his 100th birthday weibull appeared on the public disputation angrily defending his work
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was the father of the swedish historian and liberal politician jorgen weibull 1924-1998 and was buried in norra kyrkogarden in lund
lines.name: English

lines.value: clerget was the name given to a series of early rotary aircraft engine types of the world war i era that were designed by pierre clerget
lines.name: English

lines.value: manufactured in both france by clerget blin and great britain by gwynnes limited they were used on such aircraft as the sopwith camel and vickers gunbus
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1920s pierre clerget turned his attention to diesel radial engines and finally produced a h 16 engine before he died in 1943
lines.name: English

lines.value: what distinguished the clerget rotary engine from its rivals gnome and le rhone was that the clerget had normal intake and exhaust valves unlike the gnome and the connecting rod arrangement was much simpler than the le rhone
lines.name: English

lines.value: a source of failure among the clerget engines were the special purpose piston rings called obturator rings
lines.name: English

lines.value: these were located below the gudgeon or wrist pin to block heat transfer from the combustion area to the lower part of the cylinder and overcome their subsequent distortion
lines.name: English

lines.value: these rings were often made from brass and only had a lifespan of a few hours
lines.name: English

lines.value: the clerget engines were considered reliable but they cost more per unit to produce than their rivals
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike other contemporary rotaries in which the ignition system was either switched on or off to provide a rudimentary form of engine speed control the clerget featured a throttle
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bentley br1 and bentley br2 rotaries were designed as improvements of the clerget while sharing some of the earlier engine's distinctive design features
lines.name: English

lines.value: the clerget rotary engines were air cooled with either seven nine or eleven cylinders
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were fitted with a double thrust ball race which enabled them to be used either as a pusher or as a tractor engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the engines worked on a four stroke cycle
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chief points of difference from other rotary engines were
lines.name: English

lines.value: ;clerget 7z :(1918) 200 hp 150 kw 11-cylinder single row engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: ;clerget 16x :a 420 hp 310 kw 16-cylinder four row x engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1920s pierre clerget designed static diesel radial engines the earliest were based on his rotary designs
lines.name: English

lines.value: ;clerget 9a 1929 100 hp 75 kw nine cylinder single row radial engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: clerget's final engine design was an h 16 known as the type transatlantique
lines.name: English

lines.value: it developed 2000 hp 1500 kw through the use of four turbochargers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the maserati 3200 gt tipo 338 is a 2+2 grand tourer produced by maserati from 1998 to 2002
lines.name: English

lines.value: the luxury coupe was styled by italdesign whose founder and head giorgetto giugiaro previously designed among others the ghibli bora and merak
lines.name: English

lines.value: interiors design was commissioned to enrico fumia and completed by 1995
lines.name: English

lines.value: 4795 cars were produced
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 3200 gt was announced in july 1998 presented to the press in september by luca cordero di montezemolo with the participation of veteran maserati racing driver sir stirling moss and giorgetto giugiaro and finally made its public debut at the october 1998 mondial de l'automobile in paris
lines.name: English

lines.value: its name honoured the maserati 3500 gt the trident's first series production grand tourer
lines.name: English

lines.value: sold mainly in europe the 3200 gt was powered by the twin turbo 32-valve dual overhead cam 3.2-litre v8 engine featured in the quattroporte evoluzione set up to develop against the quattroporte's 335 ps- per litre
lines.name: English

lines.value: this manual transmission version was produced until 2002
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tail lights consisted of leds arranged in the shape of boomerang
lines.name: English

lines.value: the outer layer of the boomerang provided the brake light with the inner layer providing the directional indicator
lines.name: English

lines.value: deliveries started in march 1999
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1999 an automatic version of the 3200 gt became available either referred to as 3200 gt automatica or 3200 gta
lines.name: English

lines.value: introduced at the march 1999 geneva motor show it was equipped with a 4-speed conventional torque converter automatic transmission supplied by australian firm btr
lines.name: English

lines.value: engine output remained unchanged though the engine was set up specifically for the automatic according to maserati the weight increase over the manual gearbox was limited to for a kerb weight
lines.name: English

lines.value: in italy the automatica commanded a million lire premium over the 3200 gt's 149.5 million lire list price
lines.name: English

lines.value: this version was produced until 2002
lines.name: English

lines.value: in june 1999 the 1000th 3200 gt left the factory
lines.name: English

lines.value: presented to the public at the 2001 geneva motor show the 3200 gt assetto corsa was a limited edition run out version of the gt with a special handling package
lines.name: English

lines.value: limited to 259 units of which 3 were special orders it was available in three standard colours grigio touring grigio alfieri and rosso mondiale and available with manual or automatic transmission
lines.name: English

lines.value: assetto corsa was lowered by 15 mm had larger front anti roll bar stiffer springs soft compound pirelli pzero corsa tyres on dark grey or silver painted bbs alloy wheels and specific brake ventilation ducts
lines.name: English

lines.value: interior featured perforated connolly leather seats and assetto corsa script on the sill kick panels
lines.name: English

lines.value: both kerb weight and performance were unchanged from the gt.the car was replaced in early 2002 by the similarly styled but mechanically wholly new maserati coupe when maserati returned to the us market
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 3200 gt coupe body seated four and had a
lines.name: English

lines.value: the steel unibody structure was complemented by a front tubular subframe supporting the drivetrain and a rear subframe supporting the suspension links and the differential
lines.name: English

lines.value: suspension was of the double wishbone type all around with forged aluminium control arms and uprights coaxial aluminium bodied dampers and coil springs and two anti roll bars
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gearbox was in line with the front mounted engine and transmitted power to the rear limited slip differential via a two piece aluminium driveshaft
lines.name: English

lines.value: brembo supplied the braking system consisting of vented and cross drilled disks with four pot callipers on all four wheels
lines.name: English

lines.value: active safety systems included four channel anti lock braking system and bosch asr traction control system
lines.name: English

lines.value: the all aluminium v8 engine was square bore and stroke ), had two overhead camshafts per bank operating four valves per cylinder two crossflow turbochargers and a crossplane crankshaft it featured drive by wire electronic throttle control
lines.name: English

lines.value: the maserati 320s is a concept racing barchetta designed by italdesign giugiaro and based on the 3200 gt
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was first shown at the 2001 geneva motor show
lines.name: English

lines.value: a true barchetta the 320s was a single seater fully outfitted for competition with six point belts an exposed roll bar behind the driver fire extinguishing system and racing seat supplied by sparco weather protection was limited to a small aeroscreen in front of the driver
lines.name: English

lines.value: compared to the 3200 gt the 320s's wheelbase was shortened by while the engine remained the 370 ps twin turbo v8 with 6-speed gearbox
lines.name: English

lines.value: 320s bodywork of the 320s features modifications to the aerodynamic shaping of the spoiler on the rear bumper which features a supplementary nolder to increase the vertical load to the rear
lines.name: English

lines.value: anya major born 1966 in the united kingdom is an english athlete actress model and singer who starred in apple computer's 1984 commercial and in 1985 appeared as nikita in the video to elton john's song of the same name
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1983 the chiat/day advertising agency held a casting call in london on behalf of their client apple computer for what would prove to be a landmark television commercial
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vision of the agency and director ridley scott stipulated an actress capable of running up to a large video screen spinning with a sledgehammer and releasing it at the video screen
lines.name: English

lines.value: most of the models and actresses tested struggled to do this one errant throw nearly struck a passerby at the hyde park casting call
lines.name: English

lines.value: the petite major an experienced discus thrower who had been discovered at a local health club won the role with her ability to handle the hammer convincingly
lines.name: English

lines.value: the commercial officially aired only twice on american television
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was first screened in december 1983 right before the 1:00 am sign off on kmvt in twin falls idaho so that it would be eligible for advertising industry awards for that year
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition starting on january 17 1984 it was screened prior to previews in movie theaters for a few weeks
lines.name: English

lines.value: its best known appearance was just after half time of super bowl xviii on 22 january 1984
lines.name: English

lines.value: even with these limited appearances the ad created such a media frenzy that it gained many subsequent free tv airings and print mentions as it was discussed in the media
lines.name: English

lines.value: major later portrayed nikita in the elton john 1985 music video of the same name
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a spin off she released a single named moscow nights using the name anya and with that name in 1987 she released another song named one word
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2006 andy hertzfeld of the macintosh development team incorrectly stated that major had died of breast cancer in 2000
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2009 she lives in england with her husband kim rajah and their three children
lines.name: English

lines.value: rajmund rembielinski 1774–1841 was a polish nobleman szlachcic political activist and landowner
lines.name: English

lines.value: rembielinski owned estates in jedwabne krosniewice and gielczyn
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a graduate of the knight school in warsaw 1788–1792
lines.name: English

lines.value: he participated in the kosciuszko uprising
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the downfall of poland he became member of independence organisations
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the french army of napoleon bonaparte enter occupied poland he organized polish administrations in bialystok and lomza
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was member of the sejm and sejm marshal in polish congress poland in 1818 1820 and 1825
lines.name: English

lines.value: he participated in the november uprising
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the fall of the uprising he refused to execute the order of the czar to confiscate the estates and property of participants in the uprising
lines.name: English

lines.value: for that he was dismissed from all offices and received a lifelong ban from working in the administration
lines.name: English

lines.value: rembielinski was author of numerous economic agriculture and social political works
lines.name: English

lines.value: he died on february 12 1841 in lomza
lines.name: English

lines.value: patrick loubert born 1947 in toronto ontario was one of the founders of the canadian animation studio nelvana limited along with clive a smith and michael hirsh
lines.name: English

lines.value: he has produced and executive produced much of the company's most memorable fare
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the beginning of his career loubert published the great canadian comic books a 1971 book focusing on the early days of local comic lore with partner hirsh
lines.name: English

lines.value: with don haig he scripted and directed 125 rooms of comfort another live action project in 1974
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also produced the first season of inspector gadget for dic entertainment with show's creator jean chalopin the first season was animated and co produced by nelvana for disney and buena vista the adventure game toonstruck and the american thriller film malice starring alec baldwin nicole kidman and bill pullman and worked as a storyboard artist and story writer for nelvana's first feature length film rock and rule and executive story editor for the third care bears feature film the care bears adventure in wonderland
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also created the live action tv series for nelvana the edison twins and t and t starring mr t with michael hirsh and wrote scripts for the company's first two animated specials a cosmic christmas and the devil and daniel mouse as well as writing the scripts for
lines.name: English

lines.value: loubert and his colleagues won a emmy award in 1990 in the category outstanding animated program for the children's television series beetlejuice

lines.value: phycocyanin is a pigment protein complex from the light harvesting phycobiliprotein family along with allophycocyanin and phycoerythrin
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is an accessory pigment to chlorophyll
lines.name: English

lines.value: all phycobiliproteins are water soluble so they cannot exist within the membrane like carotenoids can
lines.name: English

lines.value: instead phycobiliproteins aggregate to form clusters that adhere to the membrane called phycobilisomes
lines.name: English

lines.value: phycocyanin is a characteristic light blue color absorbing orange and red light particularly near 620 nm depending on which specific type it is and emits fluorescence at about 650 nm also depending on which type it is
lines.name: English

lines.value: allophycocyanin absorbs and emits at longer wavelengths than phycocyanin c or phycocyanin r phycocyanins are found in cyanobacteria also called blue green algae
lines.name: English

lines.value: phycobiliproteins have fluorescent properties that are used in immunoassay kits
lines.name: English

lines.value: phycocyanin is from the greek phyco meaning algae and cyanin is from the english word cyan which conventionally means a shade of blue green close to aqua and is derived from the greek kyanos which means a somewhat different color dark blue
lines.name: English

lines.value: the product phycocyanin produced by aphanizomenon flos aquae and spirulina is for example used in the food and beverage industry as the natural coloring agent lina blue or exberry shade blue and is found in sweets and ice cream
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition fluorescence detection of phycocyanin pigments in water samples is a useful method to monitor cyanobacteria biomass
lines.name: English

lines.value: the phycobiliproteins are made of two subunits(alpha and beta having a protein backbone to which 1-2 linear tetrapyrrole chromophores are covalently bound
lines.name: English

lines.value: c phycocyanin is often found in cyanobacteria which thrive around hot springs as it can be stable up to around 70 °c with identical spectroscopic light absorbing behaviours at 20 and 70 °c
lines.name: English

lines.value: thermophiles contain slightly different amino acid sequences making it stable under these higher conditions
lines.name: English

lines.value: molecular weight is around 30000 da.stability of this protein invitro at these temperatures has been shown to be substantially lower
lines.name: English

lines.value: photo spectral analysis of the protein after 1 min exposure to 65 °c conditions in a purified state demonstrated a 50% loss of tertiary structure
lines.name: English

lines.value: phycocyanin shares a common structural theme with all phycobiliproteins
lines.name: English

lines.value: the structure begins with the assembly of phycobiliprotein monomers which are heterodimers composed of a and b subunits and their respective chromophores linked via thioether bond
lines.name: English

lines.value: each subunit is typically composed of eight a-helices
lines.name: English

lines.value: monomers spontaneously aggregate to form ring shaped trimers ab 3 which have rotational symmetry and a central channel
lines.name: English

lines.value: trimers aggregate in pairs to form hexamers ab 6 sometimes assisted with additional linker proteins
lines.name: English

lines.value: each phycobilisome rod generally has two or more phycocyanin hexamers
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite the overall similarity in structure and assembly of phycobiliproteins there is a large diversity in hexamer and rod conformations even when only considering phycocyanins
lines.name: English

lines.value: on a larger scale phycocyanins also vary in crystal structure although the biological relevance of this is debatable
lines.name: English

lines.value: as an example the structure of c phycocyanin from synechococcus vulcanus has been refined to 1.6 angstrom resolution
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ab monomer consists of 332 amino acids and 3 thio linked phycocyanobilin pcb cofactor molecules
lines.name: English

lines.value: both the a and b-subunits have a pcb at amino acid 84 but the b-subunit has an additional pcb at position 155 as well
lines.name: English

lines.value: this additional pcb faces the exterior of the trimeric ring and is therefore implicated in inter rod energy transfer in the phycobilisome complex
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to cofactors there are many predictable non covalent interactions with the surrounding solvent water that are hypothesized to contribute to structural stability
lines.name: English

lines.value: r phycocyanin ii r-pc ii is found in some synechococcus species
lines.name: English

lines.value: r pc ii is said to be the first peb containing phycocyanin that originates in cyanobacteria
lines.name: English

lines.value: its purified protein is composed of alpha and beta subunits in equal quantities
lines.name: English

lines.value: r pc ii has pcb at beta 84 and the phycoerythrobillin peb at alpha 84 and beta 155
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of march 7 2018 there are 44 crystal structures of phycocyanin deposited in the protein data bank
lines.name: English

lines.value: c phycocyanin has a single absorption peak at ~621 nm varying slightly depending on the organism and conditions such as temperature ph and protein concentration in vitro
lines.name: English

lines.value: its emission maximum is ~642 nm
lines.name: English

lines.value: this means that the pigment absorbs orange light and emits reddish light
lines.name: English

lines.value: r phycocyanin has an absorption maxima at 533 and 544 nm
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fluorescence emission maximum of r phycocyanin is 646 nm
