lines.name: English

lines.value: ernest dale tubb february 9 1914 - september 6 1984 nicknamed the texas troubadour was an american singer and songwriter and one of the pioneers of country music
lines.name: English

lines.value: his biggest career hit song walking the floor over you 1941 marked the rise of the honky tonk style of music
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1948 he was the first singer to record a hit version of blue christmas a song more commonly associated with elvis presley and his late 1950s version
lines.name: English

lines.value: another well known tubb hit was waltz across texas 1965 written by his nephew quanah talmadge tubb billy talmadge which became one of his most requested songs and is often used in dance halls throughout texas during waltz lessons
lines.name: English

lines.value: tubb recorded duets with the then up and coming loretta lynn in the early 1960s including their hit sweet thang
lines.name: English

lines.value: tubb is a member of the country music hall of fame
lines.name: English

lines.value: tubb was born on a cotton farm near crisp in ellis county texas now a ghost town
lines.name: English

lines.value: his father was a sharecropper so tubb spent his youth working on farms throughout the state
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was inspired by jimmie rodgers and spent his spare time learning to sing yodel and play the guitar
lines.name: English

lines.value: at age 19 he took a job as a singer on san antonio radio station kono am
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pay was low so tubb also dug ditches for the works progress administration and then clerked at a drug store
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1939 he moved to san angelo texas and was hired to do a 15-minute afternoon live show on radio station kgkl am
lines.name: English

lines.value: he drove a beer delivery truck in order to support himself during this time and during world war ii he wrote and recorded a song titled beautiful san angelo
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1936 tubb contacted jimmie rodgers widow rodgers died in 1933 to ask for an autographed photo
lines.name: English

lines.value: a friendship developed and she was instrumental in getting tubb a recording contract with rca
lines.name: English

lines.value: his first two records were unsuccessful
lines.name: English

lines.value: a tonsillectomy in 1939 affected his singing style so he turned to songwriting
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1940 he switched to decca records to try singing again and it was his sixth decca release with the single walking the floor over you that brought tubb to stardom
lines.name: English

lines.value: it sold over one million copies and was awarded a gold disc in 1965 by the riaa
lines.name: English

lines.value: tubb joined the grand ole opry in february 1943 and put together his band the texas troubadours
lines.name: English

lines.value: tubb's first band members were from gadsden alabama
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were vernon toby reese chester studdard and ray kemo head
lines.name: English

lines.value: he remained a regular on the radio show for four decades and hosted his own midnite jamboree radio show each saturday night after the opry
lines.name: English

lines.value: tubb headlined the first grand ole opry show presented in carnegie hall in new york city in september 1947
lines.name: English

lines.value: tubb always surrounded himself with some of nashville's best musicians
lines.name: English

lines.value: jimmy short his first guitarist in the troubadours is credited with the tubb sound of single string guitar picking
lines.name: English

lines.value: from about 1943 to 1948 short featured clean clear riffs throughout tubb's songs
lines.name: English

lines.value: other well known musicians to either travel with tubb as band members or record on his records were steel guitarist jerry byrd and tommy butterball paige who replaced short as tubb's lead guitarist in 1947
lines.name: English

lines.value: billy byrd joined the troubadours in 1949 and brought jazzy riffs to the instrumental interludes especially the four note riff at the end of his guitar solos that would become synonymous with tubb's songs
lines.name: English

lines.value: actually a jazz musician byrd - no relation to jerry - remained with tubb until 1959
lines.name: English

lines.value: another tubb musician was actually his producer owen bradley
lines.name: English

lines.value: bradley played piano on many of tubb's recordings from the 1950s but tubb wanted him to sound like moon mullican the honky tonk piano great of that era
lines.name: English

lines.value: the classically trained bradley tried but couldn't quite match the sound so tubb said bradley was half as good as moon
lines.name: English

lines.value: when tubb called out bradley's name at the start of one of the piano interludes the singer always referred to him as half moon bradley
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1949 tubb helped the famed boogie woogie andrews sisters crossover to the country charts when they teamed on decca records to record a cover of eddy arnold's don't rob another man's castle and the western swing flavored i'm biting my fingernails and thinking of you tubb was impressed by the enormous success of patty maxene and laverne and he remembered that their 1947 recording of the blue tail fly jimmy crack corn with folk legend burl ives produced a top 10 billboard hit and he was therefore eager to repeat that success
lines.name: English

lines.value: he brought the upbeat fingernails tune to the session hoping that the trio would like it and they did
lines.name: English

lines.value: not realizing how tall the texas troubadour was the recording technicians at decca had the sisters stand on a wooden box on one side of the one microphone they shared with tubb so that the audio would balance
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rhythm trio also wasn't used to tubb's vocal style as maxene once remembered he sang different than anybody i've ever heard
lines.name: English

lines.value: he sang the melody of the song but the timing was different
lines.name: English

lines.value: it wasn't like we were used to...you sing eight bars and then you sing eight bars and then you sing eight bars
lines.name: English

lines.value: not with him
lines.name: English

lines.value: he just sang eight bars ten bars eleven bars and then stopped whatever it was
lines.name: English

lines.value: so we'd just start to follow him and then got paid on 750000 records sold that never came above the mason dixon line tubb never possessed the best voice he always sang flat and actually mocked his own singing
lines.name: English

lines.value: he told an interviewer that 95 percent of the men in bars would hear his music on the juke box and say to their girlfriends i can sing better than him and tubb added they would be right
lines.name: English

lines.value: in fact he missed some notes horribly on some recordings
lines.name: English

lines.value: when tubb was recording you don't have to be a baby to cry in 1949 and tried to hit a low note red foley his duet partner at the time was sitting in the booth when somebody said i bet you wish you could hit that low note foley replied i bet ernest wishes he could hit that note the two who released seven albums together maintained a friendly on air feud over the years and tubb appeared on foley's ozark jubilee on abc tv
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1957 he walked into the lobby of the national life building in nashville and fired a .357 magnum intending to shoot music producer jim denny
lines.name: English

lines.value: tubb shot at the wrong man but did not hit anyone
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was arrested and charged with public drunkenness
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1960s tubb was well known for having one of the best bands in country music history
lines.name: English

lines.value: the band included lightning fingered leon rhodes who later appeared on tv's hee haw as the guitarist in the show's band
lines.name: English

lines.value: buddy emmons another pedal steel guitar virtuoso began with tubb in fall of 1957 and lasted through the early 1960s
lines.name: English

lines.value: emmons went on to create a steel guitar manufacturing company that bears his name
lines.name: English

lines.value: buddy charleton one of the most accomplished pedal steel guitarists known joined ernest in spring 1962 and continued to fall of 1973
lines.name: English

lines.value: buddy charleton and leon rhodes formed a nucleus for the texas troubadours that would be unsurpassed
lines.name: English

lines.value: beginning in the fall of 1965 he hosted a half hour tv program the ernest tubb show which aired in first run syndication for three years
lines.name: English

lines.value: that same year he was inducted into the country music hall of fame and in 1970 tubb was inducted into the nashville songwriters hall of fame
lines.name: English

lines.value: tubb inspired some of the most devoted fans of any country artist - and his fans followed him throughout his career long after the chart hits dried up
lines.name: English

lines.value: he remained as did most of his peers a fixture at the grand ole opry where he continued to appear
lines.name: English

lines.value: he continued to host his midnite jamboree radio program a few blocks away from the opry at his record shop
lines.name: English

lines.value: a notable release in 1979 the legend and the legacy paired tubb with a who's who of country singers on the cachet records label a label which tubb was connected to financially
lines.name: English

lines.value: this long out of print duets album was rereleased in 1999 as a cd on the first generations label on the 20th anniversary of its release and it quickly went out of print again
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1980 he appeared as himself in loretta lynn's autobiographical film coal miner's daughter with roy acuff and minnie pearl
lines.name: English

lines.value: his singing voice remained intact until late in life when he fell ill with emphysema
lines.name: English

lines.value: even so he continued to make over 200 personal appearances a year carrying an oxygen tank on his bus
lines.name: English

lines.value: after each performance he would shake hands and sign autographs with every fan who wanted to stay
lines.name: English

lines.value: health problems finally halted his performances in 1982
lines.name: English

lines.value: on august 14 1982 he made his final appearance on the grand ole opry
lines.name: English

lines.value: he died from his illness in 1984 at the baptist hospital in nashville tennessee
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is buried in nashville's hermitage memorial gardens
lines.name: English

lines.value: tubb was inducted into the texas country music hall of fame in 1999 and he ranked number 21 in cmt's 40 greatest men of country music in 2003
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of his sons justin tubb made a minor splash on the country music scene in the 1950s and justin's sons carey and zachary tubb also became musicians
lines.name: English

lines.value: tubb's nephew billy lee tubb was his lead guitarist briefly fall 1959-april 1960
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also had solo careers under several pseudonyms ronny wade x lincoln and played with john anderson writing several songs with him
lines.name: English

lines.value: tubb's great nephew lucky tubb has toured with hank williams iii
lines.name: English

lines.value: cal smith who played guitar for the texas troubadours during the 1960s went on to a successful country music career of his own in the 1970s recording hits such as country bumpkin
lines.name: English

lines.value: jack greene who played drums for the texas troubadours also went on to become a successful country music star following his departure from tubb's band recording the hits there goes my everything and statue of a fool
lines.name: English

lines.value: ernest tubb's nephew glenn douglas tubb wrote his first hit song for his uncle in 1952
lines.name: English

lines.value: he then went on to write more than 50 hits songs for more than two dozen country and rock music superstars including bob dylan johnny cash bj thomas george jones kentucky headhunters charlie pride ann murray and kitty wells
lines.name: English

lines.value: glenn won a grammy award for skip a rope
lines.name: English

lines.value: he currently performs the ernest tubb tribute show at the ernest tubb midnite jamboree broadcast on wsm radio and theaters across america
lines.name: English

lines.value: the song set em up joe recorded and made famous by vern gosdin was a tribute to tubb's music particularly the song walking the floor over you
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ernest tubb record store founded in 1947 is still in operation in nashville
lines.name: English

lines.value: see external link
lines.name: English

lines.value: timbits is the name of a bite sized fried dough confectionery sold at the canadian based franchise tim hortons
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were introduced in april 1976
lines.name: English

lines.value: the word timbit is a play on the word tidbit a delicate bit or morsel of food
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2009 they are available in various flavours that differ from store to store
lines.name: English

lines.value: flavours include but are not limited to chocolate glazed jelly filled dutchie honey dip sour cream glazed old fashioned plain old fashion glazed blueberry strawberry raspberry lemon apple cider orange tangerine creamy caramel cherry cake birthday cake honey cruller pumpkin spice toasted coconut and apple fritter
lines.name: English

lines.value: for tim hortons's 50th anniversary birthday cake doughnuts and timbits were sold for a limited time and given out for free on may 17 2014 the timbits being available first in the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: other doughnut chains in canada and the united states sell virtually identical products often called doughnut holes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the majority of canadians generally use the timbits trademark to designate the product while french speaking canadians prefer to use the generic term trous de beigne
lines.name: English

lines.value: in francophone tim hortons's usage however they are still called timbits
lines.name: English

lines.value: timbits also refers to participants in the timbits minor sports program a community program sponsored by tim hortons for local sports teams involving children aged four to eight years
lines.name: English

lines.value: the program places an emphasis on learning the sport and building friendships among the participants
lines.name: English

lines.value: * tim hortons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the colt canada c7 is a canadian assault rifle manufactured by colt canada formerly diemaco prior to 2005 a variant of the armalite ar 15 and having similar design and function to the colt m16a3
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c7 and its variants have been adopted as the standard issue rifle by the militaries of canada norway special forces only denmark and the netherlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: following trials c8 variants are general issue firearms for the united kingdom's special forces and other specialist users within the british military
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has been utilized in various combat deployments by canadian british norwegian dutch and danish forces in afghanistan and iraq
lines.name: English

lines.value: the development of the c7 assault rifle paralleled that of the m16a2 by colt
lines.name: English

lines.value: a canadian forces liaison officer worked with the united states marine corps in the ma6a1 product improvement program and relayed information to canada's rifle replacement program office
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c7 is much like earlier m16a1e1s rather than final product m16a2s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the earliest c7s were manufactured by colt for canadian forces as the colt model 715
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c7 series of firearms is driven by the same direct impingement gas system as the m16 series
lines.name: English

lines.value: like the m16a1 and m16a3 the c7 has both semi automatic and fully automatic fire modes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c7 also features the structural strengthening improved handguards and longer stock developed for the m16a2
lines.name: English

lines.value: diemaco changed the trapdoor in the buttstock to make for easier access and a spacer is available to adjust stock length
lines.name: English

lines.value: the most noticeable external difference between american m16a2s and diemaco c7s is the retention of the a1 style rear sights
lines.name: English

lines.value: not so apparent is diemaco's use of hammer forged barrels introduced as the canadians originally wished to use a heavy barrel profile instead of the m16a2 profile
lines.name: English

lines.value: also diemaco has developed a different mounting system from colt for the m203 grenade launcher for the c7 rifle family
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c7 has a cyclic rate of fire of around 700 900 rounds per minute rpm
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c7a1 diemaco c7ft replaces the iron sight carrying handle used on the c7 with a modified weaver rail for mounting optics
lines.name: English

lines.value: canadian development of rails preceded us standardization of the mil std 1913 picatinny rail so the canadian rail or diemaco rail differs slightly
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are 14 slots instead of 13 and each slot is narrower
lines.name: English

lines.value: the height of the rail is also higher allowing the use of normal height front sight post whereas a picatinny rail requires the use of a higher f marked front sight post
lines.name: English

lines.value: during development the original rails were vacuum bonded to the top of a bare receiver
lines.name: English

lines.value: for production the rail and receiver were made out of a single forging
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mount can use traditional iron sights or the elcan c79 optical sight 3.4x power optical sight both of which can be adjusted for individual eye relief
lines.name: English

lines.value: the optical sight was designed for the c9 light machine gun and includes horizontal and vertical mil bars used for range determination and deflection and a tritium glow in the dark aiming post rather than the traditional crosshairs
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 3.4x is powerful enough to properly see targets at the maximum accurate range of though like most magnified optical sights it is prone to criticism for creating tunnel vision in close quarters situations
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the wide aperture helps to speed target acquisition canadian soldiers generally forgo the c79 sight in favour of non magnified optical sights or backup iron sights when engaged or training in close quarters battle
lines.name: English

lines.value: the front sight was changed from the square post to a round post in diameter
lines.name: English

lines.value: with canadian involvement in afghanistan diemaco and the canadian forces have developed improvements to the c7a1 to better suit the operational situations at hand
lines.name: English

lines.value: the result the c7a2 has a four point telescoping stock unit similar to that of the c8 carbine and a 3-rail tri ad i mount on the front sight triangle
lines.name: English

lines.value: the selector lever magazine release and charging handle latch are ambidextrous
lines.name: English

lines.value: also the c7a2 is issued with green colour furniture as standard
lines.name: English

lines.value: these weapons are often seen with a similar plethora of accessories as their american counterparts given the overall commonalities of the system and the rail mounts
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c7a2 is also issued with the c79a2 elcan optical gunsight with 3.4x magnification but with a uniform green rubber armored coating but some soldiers who are issued it have either been issued or have purchased sights like the eotech holographic weapons sight and the trijicon acog
lines.name: English

lines.value: within an eight man section six soldiers will normally carry a c7a2 the section commander and second in command two grenadiers and two riflemen with only the machine gunners carrying a c9a2 lmg
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c7a2 is considered a mid life upgrade for the c7 family
lines.name: English

lines.value: the addition of the tri ad rail mount has made it easier for soldiers to attach accessories such as laser designators and tac lights
lines.name: English

lines.value: the canadian forces is looking to upgrade and modernise their stockpile of c7a2 assault rifles although nothing is yet official or certain as of mid 2016
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the biggest upgrades that might be implemented is the replacement of the standard flat top upper receiver with standard handguards handguard end cap and front sight base with a monolithic upper receiver with integrated aluminium quad rail handguard for increased modularity with accessories and free floating the barrel for augmented precision
lines.name: English

lines.value: this would put the fleet of service rifles of the canadian armed forces on par with colt canada's latest offerings and upgrades of the danish and dutch militaries who have adopted rifles with monolithic upper receivers
lines.name: English

lines.value: this version will require the use of the colt canada m203a1 with a different mounting system due to the new aluminium quad rail handguard
lines.name: English

lines.value: since colt canada developed and released the mrr modular rail rifle that uses a monolithic upper receiver with the magpul m lok attachment system the canadian armed forces might be heading in that direction instead along with a shorter 18.6 barrel instead of the standard 20 barrel and straight gas tube with a low profile gas block the possibility of using integrated suppressors is also something that is being looked into
lines.name: English

lines.value: a shorter charging handle latch will also be used as opposed to the very long c7a2 latch which gets caught on equipment and vests which causes the latch to bend and break the charging handle
lines.name: English

lines.value: the colt canada c8 carbine range are carbine variants of the c7 family and is mechanically and aesthetically very similar to the colt 653
lines.name: English

lines.value: colt made the initial c8s for canadian forces as the colt model 725
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c8 has a a1 profile barrel like the colt model 653 m16a1 carbine but with a 1 in rifling twist appropriate for the 5.56x45mm nato c77 cartridge
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c8 incorporates the design improvements featured on c7 assault rifles
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c8 has a cyclic rate of fire of around 750 950 rounds per minute rpm
lines.name: English

lines.value: the improved c8a1 diemaco c8ft is essentially a c8 carbine with a c7a1 flat top upper receiver the carbine having a 36.8 cm 14.5 barrel versus the 50.8 cm 20 barrel typically seen on the c7
lines.name: English

lines.value: the overall layout of the weapon remains essentially unchanged except for the upper receiver and the general inclusion of the c79 sight
lines.name: English

lines.value: c8a1s have also been more commonly seen with the detachable carry handle with a1 sights developed by diemaco for both the c7ft and the c8ft
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c8a1 was never officially adopted by the canadian forces and was only used in afghanistan for the ability to use the c79 optical sights
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c8a2 carbine is very similar to the c8 but having a cold hammer forged heavy 14.5 barrel as opposed to the 14.5 pencil profile barrel and a flat top upper receiver
lines.name: English

lines.value: the special forces weapon sfw features a longer barrel of a heavier profile than the c8a1
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is designed to provide a fire support capability in carbine form
lines.name: English

lines.value: a sleeve called the simon sleeve is slipped over the end of the barrel and is retained by the compensator and its crush washer
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is used to mount bayonets and m203a1s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the front sight base is strengthened for mounting of the heckler & koch ag c/eglm grenade launcher
lines.name: English

lines.value: the british military acquired a number of sfws primarily for their special forces under the designation l119a1 but has since been upgraded to l119a2 specifications
lines.name: English

lines.value: this version of the c8 is also in service with the norwegian special operations command
lines.name: English

lines.value: concerns that princess patricia's canadian light infantry had with the c8 led to the creation of the c8fthb
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c8fthb flat top heavy barrel features numerous improvements over the c8 including a heavy profile cold hammer forged m4 profile barrel featuring a grenade launcher cut out for mounting of the canadian forces m203a1 and bayonet and elcan c79 optical sight
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of the earlier c8fthb carbines used old refurbished c8 receivers
lines.name: English

lines.value: fthb was stamped next to the c8 markings on the lower receivers
lines.name: English

lines.value: colt canada later manufactured new lower receivers with c8fthb markings
lines.name: English

lines.value: later c8fthb carbines that were upgraded to the c8a3 had a3 stamped next to the markings giving c8fthba3 markings
lines.name: English

lines.value: only 400 c8fthbs were upgraded to c8fthba3s before colt canada started simply marking new receivers c8a3
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c8fthb was quickly replaced by the c8a3 which features the same cold hammer forged barrel and flat top upper receiver as the c8fthb as well as all the mid life upgrades that appeared on the c7a2 such as the green furniture ambidextrous charging handle latch magazine release and selector lever
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also includes the triad i rail for c8 which has one slot less than the c7 triad i to accommodate the m203a1 sight
lines.name: English

lines.value: two additional c8 variants exist
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c8cqb is similar to the mark 18 mod 0 cqbr having a or barrel and a vortex flash hider made by smith enterprise inc the smaller personal defense weapon pdw variant has an overall length of with stock fully retracted
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has a barrel and the receiver extension has been shortened by
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2011 the royal canadian mounted police adopted the c8 iur integrated upper receiver with ancillary components as their patrol carbine
lines.name: English

lines.value: these rifles have been built as semi automatic only
lines.name: English

lines.value: this version c8 iur is also operated by all 4 branches of the danish defence and the danish security and intelligence service's aks
lines.name: English

lines.value: s.w.a.t
lines.name: English

lines.value: colt and diemaco also paired up to develop a squad automatic weapon variant of the series
lines.name: English

lines.value: the diemaco light support weapon lsw features a heavy barrel suitable for sustained fire
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lsw can only fire automatically
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lsw has a boxy square handguard with a carrying handle and a vertical foregrip that can be used as a monopod
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lsw was made with no bayonet lug until recently because of the original bipod
lines.name: English

lines.value: a new bipod attaches to the same barrel yoke as the carrying handle and front grip so current lsws are made with a bayonet lug
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike many m16 variants it fires from an open bolt allowing the removal of the forward assist
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lsw is used by the royal danish army and the netherlands marine corps loaw loawnld fires from a closed bolt and also has a semi automatic firing mode
lines.name: English

lines.value: the diemaco lsw was originally a license produced variant of the colt 750 but both colt and diemaco have upgraded their respective weapons to include features like a detachable carry handle and other features separately
lines.name: English

lines.value: diemaco's c7/c8 family is completed with two designated marksman variants the c7ct and c8ct with ct meaning custom tactical
lines.name: English

lines.value: these accurized c7/c8 variants are designed to provide accurate engagement up to while providing system commonality to other fielded weapons
lines.name: English

lines.value: they have two stage match triggers and weighted stocks to counterbalance the heavy or free floating barrel surrounded by a tubular forestock
lines.name: English

lines.value: a removable bipod rails for designators sling etc attach to that forestock
lines.name: English

lines.value: a special distinctive pistol grip is fitted and the c7-style buttstock can be adjusted with shims
lines.name: English

lines.value: sound suppressors are usually fitted
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rifle is designed as a sniper spotter weapon or a police containment weapon
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ct series weapons meet or exceed all applicable military standards including reliability in all environmental and operational conditions accuracy lethality maintainability in field conditions and safety
lines.name: English

lines.value: custom tactical features
lines.name: English

lines.value: diemaco makes a training version of the c7 named the c10
lines.name: English

lines.value: it fires .22 long rifle ammunition but is only capable of semi automatic fire
lines.name: English

lines.value: the stock and lower receiver are one piece
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2008 or 2009 colt canada introduced a completely new designed upper receiver with integrated rail attachment system
lines.name: English

lines.value: the front handguard is in this system permanently attached to the upper receiver
lines.name: English

lines.value: the whole system is forged from one piece and is sometimes called a monolithic rail
lines.name: English

lines.value: this system allows for a completely free floating barrel
lines.name: English

lines.value: another unique feature is that the system can be adapted for different barrel lengths by screwing on an extension
lines.name: English

lines.value: the system was introduced as an upgrade in the dutch army with the c7 and c8 in 2009 and currently is introduced with the danish army
lines.name: English

lines.value: colt canada introduced the mrr or modular rail rifle in 2015 and released it for sale to the market in 2016
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is essentially a monolithic upper receiver with magpul's m lok attachment system for accessories
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rifles are offered with 11.6 14.5 15.7 and 18.6 barrels
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 11.6 version features a shorter handguard
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of late 2016 the 14.5 variant is only offered to le and the military
lines.name: English

lines.value: denmark bought the first batch of c7a1 in 1995 and c8a1 in 1996 designating them the m/95 and m/96 carbine
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2004 the lsw named lsv m/04 was added to the arsenal
lines.name: English

lines.value: these are to replace the german made m/75 h&k g3 which has been the main infantry weapon since 1975
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c7a1 is issued to standard infantry units of the royal danish army
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c8a1 is issued to units where the physically longer c7a1 can be obstructive to that units primary work such as logisticians tankers and special units
lines.name: English

lines.value: jagerkorpset and fromandskorpset special forces use the c8sfw with a barrel and extra front rails
lines.name: English

lines.value: the now defunct patruljedelingen a draftee lrrp unit also used the c8sfw
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lsw used to be issued to support gunners in infantry squads
lines.name: English

lines.value: however it is planned that the royal danish army will only use 7.62mm belt fed machine guns for the support role
lines.name: English

lines.value: most of the lsws are intended to be transferred to the danish home guard
lines.name: English

lines.value: the army almost exclusively use the c7a1 and c8a1 with the elcan c79 optical sight while the danish home guard use the c8a2 with the swedish produced aimpoint
lines.name: English

lines.value: the main feature of the aimpoint is the both eyes open sighting
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is the preferred sighting method at shorter ranges
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c7a1 was first issued to field units of logcoy/danbn/dancon of the danish international brigade in october november 1995 shortly before the transition from unprofor to ifor in bosnia
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 4 january 2009 the danish army lost a number of small arms including m/95 and m/96 rifles to armed robbers who overpowered the guards at antvorskov kaserne
lines.name: English

lines.value: the police recovered the last of the stolen weapons on 22 november 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2010 the danish defence materiel service ordered an improved version of the m/96 and m/95 from colt canada under the danish designation m/10 which colt canada designated the c8 iur
lines.name: English

lines.value: it features a floating barrel fully ambidextrous controls flip up iron sights a collapsible buttstock with more positions and the integrated upper receiver iur
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the 2015 copenhagen shootings one victim was killed with an m/95 issued to the danish home guard that was stolen in a home invasion robbery
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2007 and 2008 canada donated 2500 surplus c7 assault rifles to the afghan national army
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2011 the ana gave back the c7s since the afghan security forces chose the american m16 instead
lines.name: English

lines.value: canadian forces officials said the canadian rifles would be shipped to canada for disposal
lines.name: English

lines.value: the most commonly used version in the dutch military is the c7
lines.name: English

lines.value: the airmobile brigade consisting of 11 infantry battalion garderegiment grenadiers en jagers 12 infantry battalion regiment van heutsz and 13 infantry battalion regiment stoottroepen prins bernhard uses the c7a1 and the c8a1 diemaco c8ft was mainly used by the korps commandotroepen later replaced with the hk416 the paratroopers of the luchtmobiele brigade one company per battalion the korps mariniers and most of the recon units of the various combat units including the forward air controllers and the reconnaissance units of the cavalry and the artillery
lines.name: English

lines.value: the korps mariniers also uses the lsw which is locally known as loaw
lines.name: English

lines.value: many of the dutch c7s c8s and loaw have had an overhaul the rifle's black furniture has now been replaced by dark earth furniture
lines.name: English

lines.value: new parts include a new retracting stock the diemaco iur with ris rails for mounting flashlights and laser systems and a vertical foregrip with built in bipod the thermold plastic magazines have now become brown in color
lines.name: English

lines.value: the elcan sighting system has also disappeared in favour of the swedish made aimpoint compm4 red dot sight
lines.name: English

lines.value: these upgraded versions are now known as c7nld c8nld and loawnld
lines.name: English

lines.value: the diemaco c8 sfw special forces weapon is used by the sog and has been seen with aimpoint sights and various attachments
lines.name: English

lines.value: the uk first selected the diemaco c8 in the mid 1990s as the special forces individual weapon
lines.name: English

lines.value: this selection was later reconfirmed in the mid 2000s by which time diemaco had become colt canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: the weapon is so well liked reliable and successful that the planned competition to seek a replacement of the c8 from 2014 has been deferred in favour of continuing with the c8
lines.name: English

lines.value: use of the c8 has expanded to include among others the original sas and sbs the special forces support group the pathfinder platoon of 16 air assault brigade 43 commando fleet protection group royal military police close protection teams and mod police
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are about 2500 in service
lines.name: English

lines.value: a number of barrel lengths are available for different users and most weapons are now fitted with knights armaments rail adapter system handguards and picatinny rail flat top upper receivers
lines.name: English

lines.value: most users fit trijicon acog x4 sights with cqb reflex attachment but other sights are used
lines.name: English

lines.value: various laser light downgrip and other attachments are used
lines.name: English

lines.value: surefire vortex type flash hiders are generally fitted and suppressors are available
lines.name: English

lines.value: the standard canadian bayonet is issued but rarely used
lines.name: English

lines.value: coloured furniture is becoming commonplace
lines.name: English

lines.value: the uk very much prefers polymer magazines to metal on grounds of weight and reliability and has now standardised on these for all c8 and operational sa80 users with well over a million magazines purchased
lines.name: English

lines.value: many weapons are fitted with the l17a1 underslung 40mm grenade launcher ugl the uk designation for the heckler & koch ag c
lines.name: English

lines.value: detachable shoulder stocks are available for stand alone use of the ugl
lines.name: English

lines.value: a recent report stated that 43 commando fleet protection group would be fully armed with c8s due to their reduced ricochet limited collateral damage features
lines.name: English

lines.value: the warrior of hirschlanden krieger von hirschlanden in german is a statue of a nude ithyphallic warrior made of sandstone the oldest known iron age life size anthropomorphic statue north of the alps
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was a production of the hallstatt culture probably dating to the 6th century bc it is now in the wurttembergisches landesmuseum in stuttgart with a copy at the hirschlanden site now ditzingen baden wurttemberg germany where it was found
lines.name: English

lines.value: the preserved height is 1.50 m but the feet have been broken off
lines.name: English

lines.value: the warrior wears a pointed hat maybe - as with the real hat in the princely grave of hochdorf - made of birchbark a torc neck-ring and a belt with a typical late hallstatt dagger
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the legs are modelled with some realism the upper body is rather schematic and the face is extremely sketchy leading to speculation that the man might be intended to be seen as wearing a mask as is known from burials in klein klein styria austria trebenista macedonia and the much earlier shaft graves of mycenae ca 1500 bc.the statue shows significant weathering suggesting that it stood exposed to the elements for a long time before being buried
lines.name: English

lines.value: other anthropomorphic statues of the early iron age have been found in rottenburg tubingen stammheim and stockach all baden wurttemberg germany but they are far more stylised more carving than statue
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the following la tene period anthropomorphic statues are still very rare but examples include the finds from glauberg hessen germany holzgerlingen baden-wurttemberg germany the msecke zehrovice head bohemia and the sculptures at roquepertuse
lines.name: English

lines.value: greek influence kouroi has been discussed
lines.name: English

lines.value: numerous black figure vessels from fortified settlements of the period attest trading contacts with the mediterranean probably via the rhone river and the greek colony of massilia marseille
lines.name: English

lines.value: much closer stylistic connections exist with the far more elaborate statues from capestrano picenium italy 650-550 bc and casale marittimo middle of the 7th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: the statue was found in hirschlanden now ditzingen baden wurttemberg germany in 1963 when a low barrow was excavated
lines.name: English

lines.value: the barrow was surrounded by a stone circle and a dry stone wall
lines.name: English

lines.value: it contained 16 burials ranging from the very beginning of the iron age hallstatt d1 ca 600 bc to the beginning of the late iron age la tene period ca 450 bc
lines.name: English

lines.value: the statue was found north of the barrow but is supposed to have been originally placed on the top
lines.name: English

lines.value: * hirschlanden statue website including images
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lockheed wc 130 is a high wing medium range aircraft used for weather reconnaissance missions by the united states air force
lines.name: English

lines.value: the aircraft is a modified version of the c 130 hercules transport configured with specialized weather instrumentation including a dropsonde deployment receiver system and crewed by a meteorologist for penetration of tropical cyclones and winter storms to obtain data on movement size and intensity
lines.name: English

lines.value: the air weather service aws received its first c 130 hercules in 1962 to conduct air sampling missions in the wake of a resumption of atmospheric weapons testing by the soviet union in september 1961
lines.name: English

lines.value: the air force was then in the process of replacing its fleet of wb 50 weather reconnaissance aircraft with wb 47e jets but by 1965 the aws had decided it would better served by the wc 130 in the manned weather reconnaissance role
lines.name: English

lines.value: since that year the air force and air force reserve have operated a total of 50 wc 130s in five variants
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wc 130j weatherbird is the current weather data collection platform for the 53rd weather reconnaissance squadron
lines.name: English

lines.value: only one wc 130 has been lost on an operational mission h model 65-0965 on 12 october 1974
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1954 the air weather service aws replaced its wb 29 superfortresses as its primary weather reconnaissance platform with a fleet of wb 50ds deployed in seven squadrons
lines.name: English

lines.value: between 1956 and 1960 six wb 50 accidents resulted in the loss of an entire crew and caused the deaths of 66 crew members metal fatigue and other structural problems with the type was to end its service by 1965
lines.name: English

lines.value: the c 130 hercules was desired by the aws as the best alternative but budgetary limitations prevented the procurement of new aircraft for the mission
lines.name: English

lines.value: headquarters air force had always considered aerial weather reconnaissance an expendable luxury when budget cuts were necessary or when funds were needed for expensive programs
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1958 its desire to field a large icbm deterrent force resulted in the shutdown of two aws squadrons followed by three more in march 1960
lines.name: English

lines.value: the problems with the wb 50 brought to a head in may 1960 by fuel leaks that grounded the entire 66-plane fleet accelerated the process which scheduled a complete phaseout by 1963
lines.name: English

lines.value: aws fought against the decision however and the proposed permanent shutdown of aws's flying mission alarmed high level operational commanders worldwide including the admiral commanding the united states pacific command
lines.name: English

lines.value: the commander of the strategic air command general thomas s power recommended that the wb 50s be replaced by b 47s that were being phased out by sac and when gen curtis e lemay gave his support for the proposal modification of 34 wb 47es in 1963 for the aws was approved and the reactivation of three discontinued weather recon squadrons scheduled for 1962
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the meantime a bilateral moratorium with the soviet union on the atmospheric testing of nuclear weapons was starting its third year when a suggestion was made that the classified air sampling program monitoring the moratorium and being conducted by at least five usaf commands be consolidated under a single manager and agency
lines.name: English

lines.value: aws lobbied for the mission and submitted a plan in february 1961 naming itself the single manager
lines.name: English

lines.value: lemay now air force chief of staff approved the plan on 31 august 1961 the next day the soviet union resumed nuclear testing
lines.name: English

lines.value: headquarters air force authorized the acquisition of five new c 130bs factory configured for the sampling mission to be delivered in april 1962 when aws would become the air sampling single manager
lines.name: English

lines.value: these became the first weather mission c 130 aircraft
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the five c 130bs became operational with aws conversions of six c 130es followed in 1965 but as weather platforms
lines.name: English

lines.value: a dropsonde system was installed in all the c 130bs and the designation of all c 130 weather variants was permanently changed to wc 130 on 25 august 1965
lines.name: English

lines.value: three wc 130as were created in southeast asia in 1967 and 11 more wc 130bs were added in 1970 to replace the wb 47s which had been abruptly retired from service in september 1969
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first of 15 wc 130hs was converted in 1973 from rescue command and control aircraft that had themselves been modified from c 130es
lines.name: English

lines.value: service life of some of these variants over lapped as they operated with the 53rd 54th 55th and 56th weather reconnaissance squadrons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the e and h models have had the greatest longevity in service 28 and 32 years respectively
lines.name: English

lines.value: of the seven original weather reconnaissance squadrons four of which received the wc 130 at some point only the 53d wrs remains active now assigned to the air force reserve command afrc
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wc 130j model introduced in 1999 is currently the weather reconnaissance platform for the 53rd wrs part of the 403rd wing of the air force reserve command at keesler afb mississippi
lines.name: English

lines.value: many of the wc 130s replaced in the weather reconnaissance mission were subsequently redistributed after de modification to other afrc and air national guard wings for use again in their original tactical airlift role or as training aircraft while others were sold to foreign air forces
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wc 130 provides vital tropical cyclone forecasting information and is the primary weather data collector for the national hurricane center supplemented by the national oceanographic and atmospheric administration's wp 3d orion
lines.name: English

lines.value: they penetrate tropical cyclones and hurricanes at altitudes ranging from above the ocean surface depending upon the intensity of the storm
lines.name: English

lines.value: the most important function of these reconnaissance aircraft is to collect high density high accuracy weather data from within the storm's environment
lines.name: English

lines.value: this includes penetration of the center or hurricane eye of the storm
lines.name: English

lines.value: this vital information is instantly relayed by satellite to the national hurricane center to aid in the accurate forecasting of hurricane movement and intensity
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lockheed c 130 has been operated as a weather reconnaissance aircraft in the following sub types
lines.name: English

lines.value: five new c 130bs factory configured for air sampling were delivered to the 55th weather reconnaissance squadron at mcclellan air force base california in 1962
lines.name: English

lines.value: after operational testing and evaluation three were distributed to the 54th 56th and 57th wrs and the 55th deployed one of its remaining two to eielson air force base alaska
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1965 all had dropsonde systems installed at the warner robins air materiel area wrama and were transferred to the 53rd wrs at ramey air force base puerto rico for use in the hurricane hunter mission
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first of thousands of such missions for the just designated wc 130 was flown on 27 august 1965 into the eye of hurricane betsy the most destructive hurricane in recorded history to that time
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the aftermath of hurricane camille in august 1969 and the simultaneous shutdown of the wb 47 program funds were appropriated to fund project seek cloud an upgrade of tropical storm reconnaissance capability by an increase in c 130 platforms and an upgrade in meteorological equipment
lines.name: English

lines.value: 12 additional c 130b transports were obtained from pacific air forces and modified in 1970 1971 with the new equipment suite
lines.name: English

lines.value: one was soon transferred to noaa but the other 11 went into military service three to the 54th to replace the wc 130as and the rest to the 53rd which had transferred four of its five original b models to other squadrons after receiving seek cloud retrofits
lines.name: English

lines.value: efforts to develop forward looking and side looking weather radars were unsuccessful
lines.name: English

lines.value: the second batch of c 130bs were in service only a few years before all were de modified and turned over to the reserve forces
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wc 130bs were powered by four allison t56-a-7a turboprop engines rated at 4050 horsepower had a cruising speed of 350 ktas a radius of action of 1200 miles with a payload of 25000 lb and a service ceiling of 30000 feet
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1965 the air force procured six e model variants to replace six wb 47es in the 54th weather reconnaissance squadron at anderson air force base guam
lines.name: English

lines.value: three veteran airlifters were transferred from the tactical air command tac and three obtained new
lines.name: English

lines.value: all were modified with the amt 1 dropsonde system and assigned to the 54th wrs where they remained until 1972
lines.name: English

lines.value: from then to 1987 when they were assigned permanently to the 53d wrs the e models were assigned to the operational demands of all the operational weather reconnaissance squadrons
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1989 they were upgraded with the improved weather reconnaissance system i-wars utilizing the omega navigation system previously installed in wc 130h model and remained in regular operational service until retired in 1993
lines.name: English

lines.value: three c 130a transports were obtained from tac in 1966 during the vietnam war to conduct operation popeye a rain making operation in southeast asia
lines.name: English

lines.value: in early 1967 they were modified for an additional weather reconnaissance mission by installation of the amt 1 dropsonde system
lines.name: English

lines.value: two were based for the dual missions on a rotational basis at udorn royal thai air force base thailand with a third at anderson afb for maintenance and crew changes
lines.name: English

lines.value: missions were flown by crews of the 54th wrs and included synoptic weather reconnaissance to all areas of sea
lines.name: English

lines.value: all three reverted to c 130a standard in 1971 after their replacement by upgraded models
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the drawdown of us participation in the war in southeast asia a number of extended range hc 130h crown airborne controllers assigned to the aerospace rescue and recovery service a sister agency of the air weather service in the military airlift command became excess because of budgetary reductions
lines.name: English

lines.value: with hurricane camille still fresh in the minds of congress and the american public and retention of the aws flying mission still strong in mac headquarters aws proposed to headquarters air force in march 1972 that its 16 wc 130bs be replaced by a like number of the available hc 130hs
lines.name: English

lines.value: the request was approved in december 1972 but altered a month later
lines.name: English

lines.value: aws was ordered to retain three of the bs and could give up the other 13 in return for 11 hc 130hs
lines.name: English

lines.value: $4.5 million was budgeted for wrama to transfer the seek cloud equipment from the bs to the newer hs and the changeover occurred between june 1973 and july 1974
lines.name: English

lines.value: four additional hc 130hs were converted in 1975
lines.name: English

lines.value: a total of 15 hc 130h rescue hercules were eventually modified with seek cloud equipment and designated wc 130h replacing all 16 wc 130bs in the weather reconnaissance squadrons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wc 130h was equipped with the more powerful allison t56-a-15 turboprop engines rated at 4910 horsepower and had wing mounted fuel tanks that provided an additional 2720 gallons 10300 l of fuel extending the wc 130h's radius of action at maximum cruise speed 230 kias 350 ktas to 2250 nautical miles
lines.name: English

lines.value: a contract was awarded tracor aerospace on 29 september 1987 to build and install 20 iwrs suites but two days later the 54th wrs was inactivated,<ref group=n>manned weather reconnaissance for the second time faced a campaign to put it out of business to gain its funding this time from supporters of the defense meteorological satellite program dmsp and its tiros weather satellites at headquarters af and in the aws
lines.name: English

lines.value: a selective tropical storm reconnaissance program was instituted in the western pacific in 1971 after tiros was introduced reducing the number of sorties flown and their associated costs while the us navy had withdrawn from the manned weather reconnaissance business entirely in 1975
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a consequence the joint typhoon warning center had incrementally reduced its reliance on wc 130 data until by 1986 although unquestionably more reliable than that from the satellites it nevertheless made up less than 10% of the data used by jtwc to plot typhoons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 53d wrs at keesler was also a target but it still had strong pork barrel support in congress for its continuation that the guam based unit did not have
lines.name: English

lines.value: fuller 363-364 370 leaving only ten wc 130s in service seven with the 53d wrs and three in the air force reserve
lines.name: English

lines.value: even so the iwrs system went operational in the wc 130h in 1988 and remains standard equipment
lines.name: English

lines.value: manned weather reconnaissance continued to be reduced when aws finally divested itself of its flying mission in 1991 by inactivating the 53d wrs and transferring both the mission and its few remaining aircraft assets to the air force reserve command afrc
lines.name: English

lines.value: but the devastation wrought by hurricane andrew in 1992 again demonstrated the need for hurricane hunting and state of the art equipment to accomplish it and the 53d was resurrected as a full time unit of afrc in 1993
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wc 130s were transferred back to it but the h models were showing their age and between 1999 and 2005 all were replaced by the new technologically advanced j variant
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wc 130j was the first variant obtained new from the factory since 1965
lines.name: English

lines.value: ten were procured and assigned to the 53d wrs now the only manned weather reconnaissance unit in the department of defense
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new model encountered teething problems that delayed its initial operational capability until just before the 2005 atlantic hurricane season
lines.name: English

lines.value: conversion of the lockheed martin c 130j super hercules greatly enhanced the capability and safety of the wc 130 in its penetration of tropical cyclones on critical fix missions
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wc 130j carries a minimum crew of five pilot aircraft commander co pilot combat systems officer aerial reconnaissance weather officer and weather reconnaissance loadmaster
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 53d wrs maintains twenty air crews ten full time and ten part time to meet its capabilities obligations in support of requirements for the national hurricane operations plan of five sorties per day from keesler afb and two from deployed locations
lines.name: English

lines.value: weather data instrumentation and the dropsonde delivery and recording systems are mounted in the aircraft on removable pallets at the front end of the cargo compartment giving the aircraft a standard cargo mission capability also
lines.name: English

lines.value: the aircraft is not equipped for aerial refueling but with wing mounted auxiliary fuel tanks is capable of staying aloft almost 18 hours at an optimum cruise speed of more than
lines.name: English

lines.value: an average weather reconnaissance mission lasts 11 hours and covers almost 3500 mi
lines.name: English

lines.value: the crew collects and reports weather data as often as every minute
lines.name: English

lines.value: the aerial reconnaissance weather officer operates the computerized weather reconnaissance equipment generates the horizontal data measurements also known as recco and acts as flight director inside the storm environment
lines.name: English

lines.value: the weather officer also evaluates other meteorological conditions such as turbulence icing visibility cloud types and amounts and ocean surface winds
lines.name: English

lines.value: the arwo uses the equipment to determine the storm's center and analyze atmospheric conditions such as pressure temperature dew point and wind speed to create a vortex data message sent to the national hurricane center
lines.name: English

lines.value: a critical piece of weather equipment on board the wc 130j is the gps dropsonde windfinding system a cylindrically shaped instrument about long and in diameter and weighing approximately
lines.name: English

lines.value: the dropsonde is equipped with a high frequency radio and other sensing devices and is released from the aircraft over water
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the instrument descends to the sea surface it measures and relays to the aircraft a vertical atmospheric profile of the temperature humidity and barometric pressure and wind data
lines.name: English

lines.value: the dropsonde is slowed and stabilized by a small parachute
lines.name: English

lines.value: through use of the advanced vertical atmospheric profiling system avaps the dropsonde system operator generates the vertical data also referred to as drops needed by the nhc receiving analyzing and encoding the data for transmission by satellite
lines.name: English

lines.value: between may 2007 and february 2008 all ten wc 130j were equipped with the stepped frequency microwave radiometer sfmr or smurf which continuously measures the surface winds and rainfall rates below the aircraft mounted in a radome on the right wing outboard of the number four engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wc 130j provides data vital to tropical cyclone forecasting
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wc 130j usually penetrates hurricanes at an altitude of approximately 10000 ft to collect meteorological data in the vortex or eye of the storm
lines.name: English

lines.value: the aircraft normally flies a radius of about 100 mi from the vortex to collect detailed data about the structure of the tropical cyclone
lines.name: English

lines.value: the information collected makes possible advance warning of hurricanes and increases the accuracy of hurricane predictions and warnings by as much as 30%
lines.name: English

lines.value: collected data are relayed directly to the national hurricane center in miami fla a department of commerce weather agency that tracks hurricanes and provides warning service in the atlantic area
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 12 october 1974 a newly modified wc 130h assigned to the us air force's 54th weather reconnaissance squadron and its six crew disappeared during typhoon bess
lines.name: English

lines.value: no trace of the aircraft or its crew has ever been found and the incident is the only loss of a wc 130 on an operational mission
lines.name: English

lines.value: valery burati a former union organizer in the united states and the acting chief of the labor division of supreme commander of the allied powers scap from 1948 to 1951 during the us occupation of japan played an important role in the formation of sohyo general council of trade unions of japan the predominantly public sector union confederation
lines.name: English

lines.value: tales from the darkside the movie is a 1990 american horror anthology film directed by john harrison and based on the anthology television series tales from the darkside
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film depicts a kidnapped paperboy who tells three stories of horror to the suburban witch who is preparing to eat him a la hansel and gretel
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film is sometimes said to have been intended as creepshow 3 a sequel to george a romero and stephen king's popular horror anthologies creepshow and creepshow 2
lines.name: English

lines.value: however this is not supported by any real evidence
lines.name: English

lines.value: tom savini has been quoted as saying that this film is the real creepshow 3 which could be how the rumor started though he may just have been referring to the similar nature of the movies and the involvement of king and romero
lines.name: English

lines.value: the story titled cat from hell was originally going to appear in creepshow 2 but was scrapped due to budgetary reasons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the movie opens with betty an affluent suburban housewife and modern day witch deborah harry planning a dinner party
lines.name: English

lines.value: the main dish is to be timmy matthew lawrence a young boy whom she has captured and chained up in her pantry
lines.name: English

lines.value: to stall her from stuffing and roasting him the boy tells her three horror stories from a book she gave him titled tales from the darkside
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the first segment michael mcdowell adapts arthur conan doyle's short story lot no
lines.name: English

lines.value: a graduate student named bellingham played by steve buscemi has been cheated by two classmates susan julianne moore and lee robert sedgwick who framed him for theft to ruin his chances of winning a scholarship for which they were competing
lines.name: English

lines.value: as revenge bellingham reanimates a mummy and uses it to murder them both
lines.name: English

lines.value: susan's brother andy christian slater kidnaps bellingham and burns the parchment and mummy
lines.name: English

lines.value: he considers killing bellingham but in the end cannot bring himself to commit real murder
lines.name: English

lines.value: however bellingham brings susan and lee back from the dead having switched the reanimation parchment with a similar one and dispatches them to andy's dorm where they greet the terrified andy by saying that bellingham sends his regards
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the second tale george a romero adapts a stephen king short story of the same name
lines.name: English

lines.value: drogan is a wealthy wheelchair bound old man william hickey who brings in a hitman named halston david johansen for a bizarre hire kill a black cat which drogan believes is murderously evil
lines.name: English

lines.value: drogan explains that there were three other occupants of his house before the cat arrived his sister amanda dolores sutton her friend carolyn alice drummond and the family's butler richard gage mark margolis
lines.name: English

lines.value: drogan claims that one by one the cat killed the other three and that he is next
lines.name: English

lines.value: drogan's pharmaceutical company killed 5000 cats while testing a new drug and he is convinced that this black cat is here to exact cosmic revenge
lines.name: English

lines.value: halston doesn't believe the story but is more than willing to eliminate the cat since drogan is offering $100000
lines.name: English

lines.value: but when drogan returns to the house to see if the deed is done he finds that the cat has killed halston by climbing down his throat
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cat emerges from the hitman's corpse and jumps at drogan giving him a fatal heart attack
lines.name: English

lines.value: the third and final segment is written by michael mcdowell and based on the yuki onna a spirit or yokai in japanese folklore or more specifically lafcadio hearn's version in
lines.name: English

lines.value: a despondent artist named preston james remar witnesses a gruesome murder committed by a gargoyle like monster
lines.name: English

lines.value: the monster agrees to spare preston's life as long as he swears never to speak of what he saw or describe the monster's appearance to anyone
lines.name: English

lines.value: the monster vanishes leaving preston traumatized and confused but bound by his oath never to talk about the incident
lines.name: English

lines.value: after that night preston's life takes many turns for the better
lines.name: English

lines.value: he meets a beautiful woman named carola rae dawn chong and they fall in love marry and have two children
lines.name: English

lines.value: preston's struggling art career becomes wildly successful and life seems promising but he is tormented by memories of his encounter with the monster and his vow of silence weighs on him
lines.name: English

lines.value: one night he breaks down and tells carola about the monster even showing her a statue he sculpted of it
lines.name: English

lines.value: she appears upset and at first preston assumes she thinks he is lying
lines.name: English

lines.value: but then she lets out a heartbroken screech and reveals herself to be the very same creature he met that night
lines.name: English

lines.value: with preston's promise broken she can no longer remain human and their children transform into monstrous forms as well
lines.name: English

lines.value: she kills preston though she says that she loved him gathers their children and flies away
lines.name: English

lines.value: the final scene shows that the gargoyle and children have turned to stone upon a building ledge staring down at preston's body with sorrowful expressions
lines.name: English

lines.value: betty remarks that timmy saved the best story lover's vow for last but he says that the next one is best and has a happy ending
lines.name: English

lines.value: she replies that it's too late as she has to start cooking him and that none of the stories in the book have happy endings
lines.name: English

lines.value: as betty advances on timmy he narrates his own actions throwing some marbles on the floor causing her to slip and fall on her butcher's block impaling herself on her own tools
lines.name: English

lines.value: timmy releases himself and pushes her into her oven
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film ends with timmy helping himself to a cookie and breaking the fourth wall by saying don't you love happy endings
lines.name: English

lines.value: tales from the darkside the movie was a modest box office success for paramount
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film was released may 4 1990 in the united states opening in third place that weekend
lines.name: English

lines.value: it grossed a total of $16324573 domestically
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film was given a rating of 35% on the ratings aggregation site rotten tomatoes based on 17 reviews while receiving an overall grade of c at box office mojo
lines.name: English

lines.value: laurel productions initially announced a sequel to the film in october 1990
lines.name: English

lines.value: a screenplay was written by the first film's screenwriters michael mcdowell and george romero along with gahan wilson
lines.name: English

lines.value: segments planned included an adaptation of robert bloch's almost human alongside adaptations of stephen king's short stories pinfall originally planned for creepshow 2 and rainy season this sequel however never came to fruition
lines.name: English

lines.value: swiss french () is the variety of french spoken in the french speaking area of switzerland known as romandy
lines.name: English

lines.value: french is one of the four official languages of switzerland the others being german italian and romansch
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2015 around 2 million people in the country 24.4% of the population spoke french as their primary language and around 29.1% of the population has working knowledge of french
lines.name: English

lines.value: the french language spoken in switzerland differs very little from that of france or belgium with minor and mostly lexical differences
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is in contrast to differences between standard german and swiss german in which differences create mutual unintelligibility between speakers of the two forms to the point that they are considered different languages
lines.name: English

lines.value: the swiss variant of french is characterized by some terms adopted from franco provencal a language formerly spoken largely across the alpine communities of romandy and maintained by a minority today as well as expressions borrowed from swiss and standard german
lines.name: English

lines.value: while standard french is taught in schools and used in government media and business there is no uniform vernacular form of french among the different cantons of switzerland
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is exemplified by the usage of borrowed terms from german in regions bordering german speaking communities to their complete absence by the french border area around geneva
lines.name: English

lines.value: many differences between swiss french and french are due to the different administrative and political systems between switzerland and france
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of its distinctive lexical features are shared with belgian french and some also with quebec french such as
lines.name: English

lines.value: new york euphoria formerly known as team euphoria was one of two teams that established the lingerie football league in 2003 to 2009
lines.name: English

lines.value: the old name team euphoria was used at lingerie bowl i broadcast during super bowl xxxviii in 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were beaten by team dream by a score of 6-0
lines.name: English

lines.value: the following year the team was renamed new york euphoria and the lfl was expanded by two more teams chicago bliss and dallas desire
lines.name: English

lines.value: after defeating the chicago bliss in the eastern conference finals one of the semi finals which included a skill test a 3-on-2 match and a dance competition they met again with team dream now named los angeles temptation at the final of lingerie bowl ii and lost
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2006 they defeated the chicago bliss again in the semi final and for the first time defeated the los angeles temptation and thus won lingerie bowl iii with a winning margin of only one point obtained through a conversion with a final score of 13-12
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team was not carried over to the lfl when it made a full launch in 2009
lines.name: English

lines.value: instead new york was ostensibly represented by the new york majesty though its stadium was in fact in reading pennsylvania
