lines.value: anna maria van giersbergen born 8 march 1973 sint michielsgestel known artistically as anneke van giersbergen is a dutch singer songwriter guitarist and pianist who became known worldwide as the lead singer and songwriter for the dutch band the gathering between 1994 and 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: she also has a solo career
lines.name: English

lines.value: the project was originally called agua de annique but now goes by her own name
lines.name: English

lines.value: a frequent collaborator of arjen anthony lucassen she portrayed main characters in the albums into the electric castle 01011001 and the theater equation by his project ayreon
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2014 they collaborated on a project called the gentle storm which produced an album titled the diary that was released in 2015
lines.name: English

lines.value: since 2016 she has formed a new band vuur with members of the gentle storm live band and her own solo band to focus on the heavier side of her music
lines.name: English

lines.value: they released their debut album in this moment we are free cities in october 2017
lines.name: English

lines.value: van giersbergen has also prominently collaborated with devin townsend on many of his albums within temptation anathema lawn farmer boys napalm death moonspell novembers doom globus giant squid and many other artists and projects
lines.name: English

lines.value: van giersbergen was born in the small town of sint michielsgestel netherlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: she began singing at age 7 when she participated in a music contest
lines.name: English

lines.value: at 12 years old she participated in her school choir where she studied and toured through france
lines.name: English

lines.value: later she took singing lessons and joined several bands
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1992 she founded the duo bad breath with guitarist and singer deniz cagdas spencer edgards with music predominantly based on blues jazz folk and funk
lines.name: English

lines.value: she joined the gathering in 1994 and she is most well known for her work with them
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1998 she sang on the ayreon album into the electric castle a concept album telling the tale of an alien entity kidnapping eight human souls from different times
lines.name: English

lines.value: van giersbergen portrayed an egyptian woman from the time of the pharaohs
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2006 she appeared on the album 2006 rubicon from asia band members john wetton and geoffrey downes on the tracks to catch a thief and tears of joy
lines.name: English

lines.value: she also appears on the smear campaign by the grindcore death metal band napalm death on the tracks weltschmerz and in deference contributing spoken rather than sung vocals for good effect and relevance to the track
lines.name: English

lines.value: in june 2006 the epic rock band globus released the album epicon which included van giersbergen's vocal and writing contributions
lines.name: English

lines.value: van giersbergen co wrote the lyrics for mighty rivers run and sang lead vocal on the track as well as dueting with christine navarro on the seminal diem ex dei
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 5 june 2007 it was announced that van giersbergen would be leaving the gathering in august 2007 to focus on a new project agua de annique and spend more time with her family
lines.name: English

lines.value: she released 3 albums under this name air in 2007 and both pure air and in your room in 2009
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 24 november 2007 she performed the song somewhere with within temptation in eindhoven
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 7 february 2008 she performed the song somewhere again with within temptation at the ahoy arena in rotterdam and it was featured in the within temptation live dvd black symphony
lines.name: English

lines.value: van giersbergen also sings on the ayreon album 01011001 released in early 2008
lines.name: English

lines.value: the character she portrays is one of the forever an alien being of the same race who kidnapped her character from into the electric castle
lines.name: English

lines.value: she sings on scorpion flower from the album night eternal 2008 from moonspell
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 3 december 2008 she performed this song live with moonspell at the 013 in tilburg the netherlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: van giersbergen collaborated with devin townsend on his albums addicted in 2009 epicloud in 2012 sky blue in 2014 and transcendence in 2016
lines.name: English

lines.value: she also appeared as guest vocalist on several devin townsend project live shows including the second show in the by a thread concert series in 2011 and the retinal circus in 2012 both of which were released as dvd
lines.name: English

lines.value: she appeared as a guest vocalist on the debut album of the human experimente a project which also features robert fripp of king crimson john wetton of asia and king crimson maynard james keenan of tool a perfect circle and puscifer adrian belew u g o with sean kingston and dann pursey of globus and vantan
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2011 van giersbergen collaborated with yoav goren on the song the promise the lead track on globus second album break from this world
lines.name: English

lines.value: she co wrote lyrics as well as being a featured vocalist along with lisbeth scott on the track
lines.name: English

lines.value: she performed the track what could have been for death doom metal band novembers doom
lines.name: English

lines.value: van giersbergen also features on a track in the orchestral reinterpretations album from english progressive rock band anathema falling deeper released on 5 september 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: she has been touring with the band in south america singing the song everwake
lines.name: English

lines.value: she has released a new solo album everything is changing in 2012 and a second album drive in 2013
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 22 april 2014 arjen anthony lucassen revealed that his next project would be a collaboration with van giersbergen their third work together after the ayreon albums into the electric castle and 01011001
lines.name: English

lines.value: he described it as an epic double concept album a combination of classical meets metal and acoustic folk the project is named the gentle storm with their first album released in 2015
lines.name: English

lines.value: later in 2015 van giersbergen collaborated once again with lucassen portraying the character of fear in the musical the theater equation consisting of a three shows of a live version of the ayreon album the human equation
lines.name: English

lines.value: in february 2016 she released a collaboration album with the icelandic band arstioir called verloren verleden
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 1 december 2016 she announced the creation of her new band named vuur with musicians coming mostly from the gentle storm live band
lines.name: English

lines.value: their debut album was released in 2017
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 2017 she performed in the ayreon universe series concerts at 013 in tilburg alongside many other prominent musicians
lines.name: English

lines.value: van giersbergen's musical roots are in classical and jazz music but she enjoys rock and pop the most
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of her main influences are prince ella fitzgerald and thom yorke radiohead
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 20 february 2005 she gave birth to a son named finn whom she had with her husband rob snijders
lines.name: English

lines.value: william claire menninger october 15 1899 - september 6 1966 was a co founder with his brother karl and his father of the menninger foundation in topeka kansas which is an internationally known center for treatment of behavioral disorders
lines.name: English

lines.value: menninger was born on october 15 1899 in topeka kansas the son of florence vesta kinsley and charles frederick menninger
lines.name: English

lines.value: he had two older brothers karl and edwin
lines.name: English

lines.value: menninger graduated from washburn university in 1919 and went on to follow his father and brother into medicine
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1924 he graduated from the cornell university college of medicine in new york state
lines.name: English

lines.value: after completing a two year internship at bellevue hospital he studied psychiatry at st elizabeths hospital in washington dc in 1927
lines.name: English

lines.value: menninger married catherine wright on december 11 1925
lines.name: English

lines.value: they had three sons together roy w menninger philip b menninger and w walter menninger
lines.name: English

lines.value: they later each became active in the boy scouts reaching the rank of eagle scouts and each receiving the distinguished eagle scout award
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1927 menninger returned to topeka where he joined his father and brother karl in their medical practice
lines.name: English

lines.value: by that time they had already begun to specialize in psychiatry a relatively new field in the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: with his contributions the menninger clinic evolved into the menninger sanitarium
lines.name: English

lines.value: together they developed the menninger foundation
lines.name: English

lines.value: this non profit organization has provided clinical services to both in and out patients and engages in research education and social outreach
lines.name: English

lines.value: menninger was an early innovator and advocate for the use of bibliotherapy in treating mental illness
lines.name: English

lines.value: along with his brother karl menninger utilized bibliotherapy at the menninger clinic
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the success of karl's book the human mind menninger presented a paper to the american psychiatric association in 1937
lines.name: English

lines.value: menninger was involved with the boy scouts of america's sea scouts program in the 1930s
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was skipper of the sss kansan which was the national flagship for 1931 and 1933
lines.name: English

lines.value: the skipper's manual which he wrote for the kansas sea scouts was later used as the basis for the bsa's handbook for skippers
lines.name: English

lines.value: menninger was also a member of the national sea scout committee during this time
lines.name: English

lines.value: each of his three sons later became active in the scouts attaining the rank of eagle scouts
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the outset of world war ii menninger left the family foundation for an appointment as the director of the psychiatry consultants division in the office of the surgeon general of the united states army
lines.name: English

lines.value: he chaired the committee which produced document medical 203 a major revision of existing us classification of mental disorders
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was adopted by all the armed services
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the war this document strongly influenced the first mental disorders section of the international statistical classification of diseases published in 1949
lines.name: English

lines.value: its influence could be seen even more on the first diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders published in 1952
lines.name: English

lines.value: menninger attained the rank of brigadier general o-7 in the us army
lines.name: English

lines.value: boxhole is a young impact crater located approximately 180 km 265 km by road north east of alice springs in the northern territory australia
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is 170 metres in diameter and its age is estimated to be 5400 ± 1500 years based on the cosmogenic 14 c terrestrial age of the meteorite placing it in the holocene
lines.name: English

lines.value: the crater is exposed to the surface
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1937 joe webb a shearer at boxhole sheep station took geologist cecil madigan to examine the crater
lines.name: English

lines.value: madigan discovered nickel bearing metallic fragments and iron shale balls similar to those found at henbury to the south of alice springs
lines.name: English

lines.value: a later search found additional meteoritic metal including an iron mass of 181 pounds 82 kg now in the natural history museum london
lines.name: English

lines.value: a christmas stocking is an empty sock or sock shaped bag that is hung on christmas eve so that santa claus or father christmas can fill it with small toys candy fruit coins or other small gifts when he arrives
lines.name: English

lines.value: these small items are often referred to as stocking stuffers or stocking fillers
lines.name: English

lines.value: in some christmas stories the contents of the christmas stocking are the only toys the child receives at christmas from santa claus in other stories and in tradition some presents are also wrapped up in wrapping paper and placed under the christmas tree
lines.name: English

lines.value: tradition in western culture threatens that a child who behaves badly during the year will receive only a piece or pile of coal
lines.name: English

lines.value: however coal is rarely if ever left in a stocking as it is considered cruel
lines.name: English

lines.value: some people even put their christmas stocking by their bedposts so santa claus can fill it by the bed while they sleep
lines.name: English

lines.value: while there are no written records of the origin of the christmas stocking there are popular legends that attempt to tell the history of this christmas tradition
lines.name: English

lines.value: one such legend has several variations but the following is a good example :very long ago there lived a poor man and his three very beautiful daughters
lines.name: English

lines.value: he had no money to get his daughters married and he was worried what would happen to them after his death
lines.name: English

lines.value: saint nicholas was passing through when he heard the villagers talking about the girls
lines.name: English

lines.value: st nicholas wanted to help but knew that the old man wouldn't accept charity
lines.name: English

lines.value: he decided to help in secret
lines.name: English

lines.value: after dark he threw three bags of gold through an open window one landed in a stocking
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the girls and their father woke up the next morning they found the bags of gold and were of course overjoyed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the girls were able to get married and live happily ever after
lines.name: English

lines.value: other versions of the story say that saint nicholas threw the three bags of gold directly into the stockings which were hung by the fireplace to dry
lines.name: English

lines.value: this led to the custom of children hanging stockings or putting out shoes eagerly awaiting gifts from saint nicholas
lines.name: English

lines.value: sometimes the story is told with gold balls instead of bags of gold
lines.name: English

lines.value: that is why three gold balls sometimes represented as oranges are one of the symbols for st nicholas
lines.name: English

lines.value: and so st nicholas is a gift giver
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is also the origin of three gold balls being used as a symbol for pawnbrokers
lines.name: English

lines.value: a tradition that began in a european country originally children simply used one of their everyday socks but eventually special christmas stockings were created for this purpose
lines.name: English

lines.value: the christmas stocking custom is derived from the germanic/scandinavian figure odin
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to phyllis siefker children would place their boots filled with carrots straw or sugar near the chimney for odin's flying horse sleipnir to eat
lines.name: English

lines.value: odin would reward those children for their kindness by replacing sleipnir's food with gifts or candy
lines.name: English

lines.value: this practice she claims survived in germany belgium and the netherlands after the adoption of christianity and became associated with saint nicholas as a result of the process of christianization
lines.name: English

lines.value: today stores carry a large variety of styles and sizes of christmas stockings and christmas stockings are also a popular homemade craft
lines.name: English

lines.value: this claim is disputed though as there are no records of stocking filling practices related to odin until there is a merging of st nicholas with odin
lines.name: English

lines.value: st nicholas had an earlier merging with the grandmother cult in bari italy where the grandmother would put gifts in stockings
lines.name: English

lines.value: this merged st nicholas would later travel north and merge with the odin cults
lines.name: English

lines.value: many families create their own christmas stockings with each family member's name applied to the stocking so that santa will know which stocking belongs to which family member
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the guinness world records the largest recorded christmas stocking measured 51 m 35 cm 168 ft 5.65 in in length and 21 m 63 cm 70 ft 11.57 in in width heel to toe and was produced by a volunteer emergency services organisation in carrara tuscany italy on 5 january 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: to fulfill the guinness guideline that the stocking contain presents volunteers filled it with balloons containing sweets
lines.name: English

lines.value: prior to this the record had been broken in london on 14 december 2007 by volunteers of the children's society whose stocking measured 32.56m long and 14.97m wide
lines.name: English

lines.value: net metering or net energy metering nem allows consumers who generate some or all of their own electricity to use that electricity anytime instead of when it is generated
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is particularly important with renewable energy sources like wind and solar which are non dispatchable when not coupled to storage
lines.name: English

lines.value: monthly net metering allows consumers to use solar power generated during the day at night or wind from a windy day later in the month
lines.name: English

lines.value: annual net metering rolls over a net kilowatt credit to the following month allowing solar power that was generated in july to be used in december or wind power from march in august
lines.name: English

lines.value: net metering policies can vary significantly by country and by state or province if net metering is available if and how long banked credits can be retained and how much the credits are worth retail wholesale
lines.name: English

lines.value: most net metering laws involve monthly roll over of kwh credits a small monthly connection fee require monthly payment of deficits i.e normal electric bill and annual settlement of any residual credit
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike a feed in tariff fit which requires two meters net metering uses a single bi directional meter and can measure current flowing in two directions
lines.name: English

lines.value: net metering can be implemented solely as an accounting procedure and requires no special metering or even any prior arrangement or notification
lines.name: English

lines.value: net metering is an enabling policy designed to foster private investment in renewable energy
lines.name: English

lines.value: net metering originated in the united states where small wind turbines and solar panels were connected to the electrical grid and consumers wanted to be able to use the electricity generated at a different time or date from when it was generated
lines.name: English

lines.value: minnesota is commonly cited as passing the first net metering law in 1983 and allowed anyone generating less than 40 kw to either roll over any kilowatt credit to the next month or be paid for the excess
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2000 this was amended to compensation at the average retail utility energy rate this is the simplest and most general interpretation of net metering and in addition allows small producers to sell electricity at the retail rate
lines.name: English

lines.value: utilities in idaho adopted net metering in 1980 and in arizona in 1981
lines.name: English

lines.value: massachusetts adopted net metering in 1982
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1998 22 states or utilities therein had adopted net metering
lines.name: English

lines.value: two california utilities initially adopted a monthly net metering charge which included a standby charge until the puc banned such charges
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2005 all us utilities were required to offer net metering upon request excess generation is not addressed
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2018 43 us states have adopted net metering as well as utilities in 3 of the remaining states leaving only 4 states without any established procedures for implementing net metering
lines.name: English

lines.value: however a 2017 study showed that only 3% of us utilities offer full retail compensation for net metering with the remainder offering less than retail rates having credit expire annually or some form of indefinite rollover
lines.name: English

lines.value: net metering was slow to be adopted in europe especially in the united kingdom because of confusion over how to address the value added tax vat
lines.name: English

lines.value: only one utility company in great britain offers net metering
lines.name: English

lines.value: the united kingdom government is reluctant to introduce the net metering principle because of complications in paying and refunding the value added tax that is payable on electricity but pilot projects are underway in some areas
lines.name: English

lines.value: in canada some provinces have net metering programs
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the philippines net metering scheme is governed by republic act 9513 renewable energy act of 2008 and it's implementing rules and regulation irr
lines.name: English

lines.value: the implementing body is the energy regulatory commission erc in consultation with the national renewable energy board nreb
lines.name: English

lines.value: unfortunately the scheme is not a true net metering scheme but in reality a net billing scheme
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the dept of energy's net metering guidelines say net-metering allows customers of distribution utilities dus to install an on site renewable energy re facility not exceeding 100 kilowatts kw in capacity so they can generate electricity for their own use
lines.name: English

lines.value: any electricity generated that is not consumed by the customer is automatically exported to the du's distribution system
lines.name: English

lines.value: the du then gives a peso credit for the excess electricity received equivalent to the du's blended generation cost excluding other generation adjustments and deducts the credits earned to the customer's electric bill thus philippine consumers who generate their own electricity and sell their surplus to the utility are paid what is called the generation cost which is often less than 50% of the retail price of electricity
lines.name: English

lines.value: net metering is controversial as it affects different interests on the grid
lines.name: English

lines.value: a report prepared by peter kind of energy infrastructure advocates for the trade association edison electric institute stated that distributed generation systems like rooftop solar present unique challenges to the future of electric utilities
lines.name: English

lines.value: utilities in the united states have led a largely unsuccessful campaign to eliminate net metering
lines.name: English

lines.value: renewable advocates point out that while distributed solar and other energy efficiency measures do pose a challenge to electric utilities existing business model the benefits of distributed generation outweigh the costs and those benefits are shared by all ratepayers
lines.name: English

lines.value: grid benefits of private distributed solar investment include reduced need for centralizing power plants and reduced strain on the utility grid
lines.name: English

lines.value: they also point out that as a cornerstone policy enabling the growth of rooftop solar net metering creates a host of societal benefits for all ratepayers that are generally not accounted for by the utility analysis including public health benefits employment and downstream economic effects market price impacts grid security benefits and water savings
lines.name: English

lines.value: an independent report conducted by the consulting firm crossborder energy found that the benefits of california's net metering program outweigh the costs to ratepayers
lines.name: English

lines.value: those net benefits will amount to more than us$92 million annually upon the completion of the current net metering program
lines.name: English

lines.value: a 2012 report on the cost of net metering in the state of california commissioned by the california public utilities commission cpuc showed that those customers without distributed generation systems will pay us$287 in additional costs to use and maintain the grid every year by 2020
lines.name: English

lines.value: the report also showed the net cost will amount to us$1.1 billion by 2020
lines.name: English

lines.value: notably the same report found that solar customers do pay more on their power bills than what it costs the utility to serve them table 5 page 10 average 103% of their cost of service across the three major utilities in 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: many electric utilities state that owners of generation systems do not pay the full cost of service to use the grid thus shifting their share of the cost onto customers without distributed generation systems
lines.name: English

lines.value: most owners of rooftop solar or other types of distributed generation systems still rely on the grid to receive electricity from utilities at night or when their systems cannot generate sufficient power
lines.name: English

lines.value: a 2014 report funded by the institute for electric innovation claims that net metering in california produces excessively large subsidies for typical residential rooftop solar pv facilities
lines.name: English

lines.value: these subsidies must then be paid for by other residential customers most of whom are less affluent than the rooftop solar pv customers
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition the report points out that most of these large subsidies go to the solar leasing companies which accounted for about 75 percent of the solar pv facilities installed in 2013
lines.name: English

lines.value: the report concludes that changes are needed in california ranging from the adoption of retail tariffs that are more cost reflective to replacing net metering with a separate buy all sell all arrangement that requires all rooftop solar pv customers to buy all of their consumed energy under the existing retail tariffs and separately sell all of their onsite generation to their distribution utilities at the utilities respective avoided costs
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is considerable confusion between the terms net metering and feed in tariff in general there are three types of compensation for local distributed generation
lines.name: English

lines.value: time of use tou net metering employs a smart electric meter that is programmed to determine electricity usage any time during the day
lines.name: English

lines.value: time of use allows utility rates and charges to be assessed based on when the electricity was used i.e day night and seasonal rates
lines.name: English

lines.value: typically the generation cost of electricity is highest during the daytime peak usage period and lowest at night
lines.name: English

lines.value: time of use metering is a significant issue for renewableenergy sources since for example solar power systems tend to produce energy during the daytime peak price period and produce little or no power during the night period when price is low
lines.name: English

lines.value: italy has installed so many photovoltaic cells that peak prices no longer are during the day but are instead in the evening
lines.name: English

lines.value: tou net metering affects the apparent cost of net metering to a utility
lines.name: English

lines.value: in market rate net metering systems the user's energy use is priced dynamically according to some function of wholesale electric prices
lines.name: English

lines.value: the users meters are programmed remotely to calculate the value and are read remotely
lines.name: English

lines.value: net metering applies such variable pricing to excess power produced by a qualifying system
lines.name: English

lines.value: market rate metering systems were implemented in california starting in 2006 and under the terms of california's net metering rules will be applicable to qualifying photovoltaic and wind systems
lines.name: English

lines.value: under california law the payback for surplus electricity sent to the grid must be equal to the variable in this case price charged at that time
lines.name: English

lines.value: net metering enables small systems to result in zero annual net cost to the consumer provided that the consumer is able to shift demand loads to a lower price time such as by chilling water at a low cost time for later use in air conditioning or by charging a battery electric vehicle during off peak times while the electricity generated at peak demand time can be sent to the grid rather than used locally see vehicle to grid
lines.name: English

lines.value: no credit is given for annual surplus production
lines.name: English

lines.value: excess generation is a separate issue from net metering but it is normally dealt with in the same rules because it can arise
lines.name: English

lines.value: if local generation offsets a portion of the demand net metering is not used
lines.name: English

lines.value: if local generation exceeds demand some of the time for example during the day net metering is used
lines.name: English

lines.value: if local generation exceeds demand for the billing cycle best practices calls for a perpetual roll over of the kilowatt credits although some regions have considered having any kilowatt credits expire after 36 months
lines.name: English

lines.value: the normal definition of excess generation is annually although the term is equally applicable monthly
lines.name: English

lines.value: the treatment of annual excess generation and monthly ranges from lost to compensation at avoided cost to compensation at retail rate
lines.name: English

lines.value: left over kilowatt credits upon termination of service would ideally be paid at retail rate from the consumer standpoint and lost from the utility standpoint with avoided cost a minimum compromise
lines.name: English

lines.value: some regions allow optional payment for excess annual generation which allows perpetual roll over or payment at the customers choice
lines.name: English

lines.value: both wind and solar are inherently seasonal and it is highly likely to use up a surplus later unless more solar panels or a larger wind turbine have been installed than needed
lines.name: English

lines.value: net metering systems can have energy storage integrated to store some of the power locally i.e from the renewable energy source connected to the system rather than selling everything back to the mains electricity grid
lines.name: English

lines.value: often the batteries used are industrial deep cycle batteries as these last for 10 to 20 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: lead acid batteries are often also still used but last much less long 5 years or so
lines.name: English

lines.value: lithium ion batteries are sometimes also used but too have a relatively short lifespan
lines.name: English

lines.value: finally nickel iron batteries last the longest with a lifespan of up to 40 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: a 2017 study of solar panels with battery storage indicated an 8 to 14 percent extra consumption of electricity from charging and discharging batteries
lines.name: English

lines.value: in some australian states the feed in tariff is actually net metering except that it pays monthly for net generation at a higher rate than retail with environment victoria campaigns director mark wakeham calling it a fake feed in tariff a feed in tariff requires a separate meter and pays for all local generation at a preferential rate while net metering requires only one meter
lines.name: English

lines.value: the financial differences are very substantial

lines.value: net metering was pioneered in the united states as a way to allow solar and wind to provide electricity whenever available and allow use of that electricity whenever it was needed beginning with utilities in idaho in 1980 and in arizona in 1981
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1983 minnesota passed the first state net metering law
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of march 2015 44 states and washington dc have developed mandatory net metering rules for at least some utilities
lines.name: English

lines.value: however although the states rules are clear few utilities actually compensate at full retail rates
lines.name: English

lines.value: net metering policies are determined by states which have set policies varying on a number of key dimensions
lines.name: English

lines.value: the energy policy act of 2005 required state electricity regulators to consider but not necessarily implement rules that mandate public electric utilities make available upon request net metering to their customers
lines.name: English

lines.value: several legislative bills have been proposed to institute a federal standard limit on net metering
lines.name: English

lines.value: they range from hr 729 which sets a net metering cap at 2% of forecasted aggregate customer peak demand to hr 1945 which has no aggregate cap but does limit residential users to 10 kw a low limit compared to many states such as new mexico with an 80000 kw limit or states such as arizona colorado new jersey and ohio which limit as a percentage of load
lines.name: English

lines.value: arizona california colorado connecticut delaware maryland massachusetts new hampshire new jersey new york ohio oregon pennsylvania utah vermont and west virginia are considered the most favorable states for net metering as they are the only states to receive an a rating from freeing the grid in 2015

lines.value: regulators in multiple states are acting as referees in debates between utility companies and advocates of distributed resources such as solar panel arrays
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2016 the national association of regulatory utility commissioners naruc published the manual on distributed energy resources compensation as a way to help states decide on rate structures dealing with homes and businesses that generate their own power and send excess power back to the electric grid
lines.name: English

lines.value: the intention behind the manual is to provide a consistent framework for evaluating rate design decisions in the age of distributed energy resources the president of naruc when he commissioned the manual said his instructions to the committee writing the manual were to write a practical expert and most importantly ideologically neutral guide that offers advice to states
lines.name: English

lines.value: a draft of the manual was released in july which generated more than 70 public comments from stakeholder groups
lines.name: English

lines.value: those comments were reviewed and the final version of the manual was designed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the updated manual covers various issues that state regulators have been struggling with including net metering the value of solar energy and cost shifting from der to non der customers
lines.name: English

lines.value: der is being integrated into the national grid at a rapid pace and the system of electricity generation delivery and utilization are constantly changing with new technology
lines.name: English

lines.value: the edison electric institute and the solar energy industries association both supported the manual
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the main point of contention between utility companies and the solar industry is the question of whether distributed generation systems represent cost shift from those with the systems people with solar panels to those without them everyone else who uses electricity
lines.name: English

lines.value: phil moeller of the edison electric institute said we want to der [distributed energy resources] but we want to make sure the rate structure is right to minimize cost shifts moeller is a former member of the federal energy regulatory commission ferc a federal government regulatory agency
lines.name: English

lines.value: sean gallaher of the solar energy industries association said there seems to be an assumption that revenue erosion from der results in an inadequacy of cost recovery for the utility and therefore a shift of costs to non participating customers
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to utility dive there are relatively few solar customers in arkansas and advocates worry changes in the next part of the proceeding could slow the market's growth if regulators make too deep a cut to remuneration rates in arkansas early in 2017 state regulators voted to grandfather existing solar customers into the current retail net metering rate until 2037
lines.name: English

lines.value: the arkansas public service commission convened a working group to look at the costs and benefits of net metering the working group was split along ideological lines and each of two subgroups submitted its own set of recommendations instead of a having a unified position
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first subgroup composed of conservation and advanced energy groups wanted no changes to the state's net metering rates
lines.name: English

lines.value: the second subgroup made up of public utilities wanted to have an embedded cost service approach that would determine the costs and benefits associated with that metering
lines.name: English

lines.value: entergy was a part of the second subgroup and said the current net metering policy that credits excess generation at the full retail rate must be changed for new net metering customers that second group argued that crediting net metering customers for costs that are not avoided means that the electric utility does not recover its entire cost of providing service to each net metering customer net of quantifiable benefits

lines.value: thomas sutherland may 3 1931 - july 22 2016 dean of agriculture at the american university of beirut in lebanon was kidnapped by islamic jihad members near his beirut home on june 9 1985
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was released on november 18 1991 at the same time as terry waite having been held hostage for 2353 days
lines.name: English

lines.value: born in falkirk scotland on may 3 1931 sutherland was signed as a 17-year-old by rangers fc sutherland obtained a bsc in agriculture from glasgow university and moved to the united states in the 1950s
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was awarded a master's degree and phd in animal breeding from iowa state university then taught animal science at colorado state university for 26 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: he moved to beirut in 1983 for a three year term as dean of the faculty of agriculture and food science in the american university in beirut
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite the assassination of university president malcolm h kerr and the kidnapping of professor frank reiger in 1984 and despite being warned repeatedly by the state department to leave sutherland remained at the university
lines.name: English

lines.value: two weeks after david p jacobsen was abducted sutherland was also kidnapped while using the limousine of university president calvin plimpton
lines.name: English

lines.value: upon his release sutherland claimed that the kidnappers mistook him for plimpton
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was the second longest held captive after terry anderson
lines.name: English

lines.value: his memories of the experience were published in a book co authored by his wife jean at your own risk ().
lines.name: English

lines.value: he claims to have attempted suicide a number of times and to have spent a substantial amount of time in solitary confinement
lines.name: English

lines.value: in june 2001 the sutherland family won a $323 million verdict in a lawsuit against the frozen assets of the government of iran because of evidence that iran had directed terrorists to kidnap americans in lebanon
lines.name: English

lines.value: in accordance with section 2002 of the victims of trafficking and violence protection act of 2000 sutherland and his family received $35041877.36 including interest and the lien for the rest of the original settlement is now held by the us government
lines.name: English

lines.value: sutherland died on july 22 2016 in fort collins colorado aged 85

lines.value: thomond (; modern irish tuamhain was a kingdom of gaelic ireland associated geographically with present day county clare and county limerick as well as parts of county tipperary
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kingdom represented the core homeland of the dal gcais people although there were other gaels in the area such as the eile and eoganachta and even the norse of limerick
lines.name: English

lines.value: it existed from the collapse of the kingdom of munster in the 12th century as competition between the o briain and the mac carthaigh led to the schism between thomond north munster and desmond south munster
lines.name: English

lines.value: it continued to exist outside of the anglo norman controlled lordship of ireland until the 16th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: the exact origin of thomond originally as an internal part of munster is debated
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is generally held that the deisi muman pushed north west starting from the 5th to the early 8th century taking the area from the ui fiachrach aidhne of the connachta
lines.name: English

lines.value: eventually the dal gcais rose to power in all of munster to the detriment of the eoganachta
lines.name: English

lines.value: the person most famously associated with this is brian boruma high king of ireland best known for his feats at the battle of clontarf
lines.name: English

lines.value: four generations down the line and after providing three more high kings the dal gcais were unable to hold onto all of munster and so thomond came into being as a separate entity
lines.name: English

lines.value: between the mid 12th and late 13th century when much of ireland came under direct english control and or settlement thomond too came into the anglo irish sphere
lines.name: English

lines.value: the de clare family established a colony at bunratty while the butler and fitzgerald families also made inroads
lines.name: English

lines.value: however from the time of the battle of dysert o'dea thomond was restored as a kingdom with its rulers reinstating limerick within their overrule
lines.name: English

lines.value: not until the 1540s did the ruling o'brien dynasty accommodate with english rule
lines.name: English

lines.value: county clare was sometimes known as county thomond in the period immediately after its creation from the district of thomond
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1841 an estimation of the extent of the kingdom was undertaken by john o'donovan and eugene curry the principality of thomond generally called the country of the dal cais comprised the entire of the present co of clare the parishes of iniscaltra and clonrush in the county of galway the entire of ely o'carroll the baronies of ikerrin upper and lower ormond owney and arra and somewhat more than the western half of the barony of clanwilliam in the county of tipperary the baronies of owenybeg coonagh and clanwilliam and the eastern halves of the baronies of small county and coshlea in the county of limerick
lines.name: English

lines.value: the entire province of munster was under the control of the o'brien ua briain clan under the leadership of toirrdelbach ua briain and his son muirchertach from 1072-1114
lines.name: English

lines.value: their capital was located in limerick
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a bid to secure the high kingship of ireland for the clan muirchertach encouraged ecclesiastical reform in 1111 with the creation of territorial dioceses over the entire island
lines.name: English

lines.value: they had support for their bid from several foreign connections including the norwegian king magnus bareleg and the anglo norman baron arnulf de montgomery who were both united to the clan through marriage in 1102
lines.name: English

lines.value: their claim to the high kingship was countered by the o'neill ui neill clan in ulster under the leadership of domnall maclochlainn of ailech
lines.name: English

lines.value: though muirchertach campaigned hard in the north he was unable to obtain the submission of ailech
lines.name: English

lines.value: when he fell ill in 1114 he was deposed by his brother diarmait
lines.name: English

lines.value: muirchertach did briefly regain power but after his death in 1119 his brother's sons took control of the clan
lines.name: English

lines.value: maclochlainn's plans to restore the high kingship to the north was thwarted by his ally tairrdelbach ua conchobair of connacht who formed an alliance with the o'brien's
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1118 conchobair partitioned munster between the sons of diarmait and tagh mac carthaig
lines.name: English

lines.value: the northern section of the province became the o'brien kingdom of thomond tuadh mhumhain north munster and the southern became the mac carthaigh kingdom of desmond deas mhumhain south munster
lines.name: English

lines.value: from the 12th to the 14th centuries the norman invasion and their multiple attempts to take thomond from the gaels was the main challenge to the realm
lines.name: English

lines.value: the picture was complicated by rival branches of the o briain trying to ally with various different normans to enforce their own line as reigning over thomond
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the time of the norman invasion of ireland in 1169 domhnall mor o briain was king of thomond
lines.name: English

lines.value: domhnall was a man of realpolitik his main concern was upholding his position in thomond and was not against collaborating with strongbow and others against rival gaelic kingdoms such as ossory desmond and connacht
lines.name: English

lines.value: domhnall even acknowledged henry ii as lord of ireland at cashel in 1171 but a mere two years later when plantagenet tried to grant thomond to philip de braose this situation was overturned
lines.name: English

lines.value: the dal gcais defeated a norman army at the battle of thurles in 1174 where over 700 were killed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the following year when raymond le gros captured limerick through a naval invasion domhnall retook it and burned it rather than have it in foreign hands
lines.name: English

lines.value: the twenty years after that for the gaels of thomond were more secure
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the death of domhnall mor a period of destructive feuding among his offspring caused a great territorial decline in thomond
lines.name: English

lines.value: the brothers muircheartach finn o briain and conchobhar ruadh o briain fought with each other seeing muircheartach's reign interrupted between 1198-1203
lines.name: English

lines.value: muirchertach himself was blinded by the normans in 1208 and was soon forced into abdication due to no longer being righdamhna
lines.name: English

lines.value: donnchadh cairprech o briain had to deal with dissent from the mac con mara and o coinn against his rule so brought in the laigin's mac gormain as his standard bearers
lines.name: English

lines.value: donnchadh also enlisted the support of the de burgh and other normans in this fight which came at a costly price limerick and lands surrounding it in what would later become county limerick and county tipperary
lines.name: English

lines.value: under pressure from the butlers thomond was now not too different to what would become county clare protected by the river shannon
lines.name: English

lines.value: donnchadh moved his capital to clonroad
lines.name: English

lines.value: the normans advance continued during the reign of conchobhar na suidaine o briain as henry iii granted lands to robert de muscregos and john fitzgeoffrey
lines.name: English

lines.value: of the two de muscregos was most active constructing clare castle and bunratty castle with a colony
lines.name: English

lines.value: the precedent for thomond was very dangerous as should much more land have been taken the realm would have no longer existed
lines.name: English

lines.value: conchobhar and his fiery son tadhg cael uisce o briain took up arms and slaughtered many of the norman settler colonists in 1257
lines.name: English

lines.value: the following year the gaelic chiefs from all over ireland had resolved to form an anti norman pact and met at cael uisce near lough erne to discuss terms
lines.name: English

lines.value: they planned to resurrect the high kingship of ireland with most supporting brian o neill as the choice
lines.name: English

lines.value: tadhg was proud and stubborn declaring his father should be high king the dal gcais thus did not take part in the battle of druim dearg which the gaels lost damaging the reputation of thomond as a consequence
lines.name: English

lines.value: brian ruadh o briain kept the pressure up by burning clare castle and forcing the de muscregos to flee to wales but he had troubles from his own countrymen
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mac con mara o deaghaidh and mac gormain clans supported his nephew toirdelbach o briain a son of tadhg cael uisce for the kingship instead and revolted
lines.name: English

lines.value: seeing an opportunity edward ii offered thomond to thomas de clare if he could take advantage of the o briain feud
lines.name: English

lines.value: the events which followed have passed down to history as the cathreim thoirdhealbhaigh
lines.name: English

lines.value: after brian briefly regained clonroad with de clare's help toirdelbach arrived with support from galway in the form of the de burghs and once again took control in 1277
lines.name: English

lines.value: brian was executed by his ally at bunratty but de clare was soon reconciled with his son donnchadh mac brian o briain and supported him against toirdelbach
lines.name: English

lines.value: the feud continued until donnchadh drowned at a party on islandmagrath on the river fergus
lines.name: English

lines.value: with toirdelbach now undisputed king the mac con mara were able to hound de clare
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conflict between the two lines continued into the next generation between donnchadh mac toirdelbach o briain backed by william liath de burgh and diarmuid cleirech o briain backed by richard de clare
lines.name: English

lines.value: there was military success at bunratty in 1311 for diarmuid and his cousin donnchadh was killed at corcomroe
lines.name: English

lines.value: following this clann tadhg's leader was muircheartach mac toirdelbach o briain and after diarmuid's sudden death clann briain ruadh's leader became donnchadh mac domhnall o briain
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bruce wars in ireland added an unpredictable element and saw some surprising ad hoc alliances come into play
lines.name: English

lines.value: donnchadh elected to support edward the bruce which made his patron de clare an enemy
lines.name: English

lines.value: muircheartach who now reigned supreme in thomond due to his connection to de burgh was nominally on the side of the lordship of ireland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cousins fought at the second battle of athenry
lines.name: English

lines.value: muircheartach's brother diarmuid mac toirdelbach o briain managed to destroy donnchadh and most of clann briain ruadh's supporters at the battle of corcomroe in 1317
lines.name: English

lines.value: the end of the de clares and norman territorial claims in thomond came the following year at the battle of dysert o'dea due largely to conchobhar o deaghaidh whose tactics secured a famous victory
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last successful attempt by a norman to play divide and conquer within the thomond kingship was the case of maurice fitzgerald earl of desmond
lines.name: English

lines.value: a very powerful man he was constantly rumoured during his life to have wanted to make himself king of ireland
lines.name: English

lines.value: he successfully sponsored brian ban o briain in overthrowing diarmuid from clan tadhg during 1343-1350 but equally decisive was the sides taken by mac con mara leading to diarmuid's restoration
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the exception of a failed norman attempt to reconstruct bunratty castle by thomas de rokeby from 1353-1355 the norman settler colonialist project in thomond was at an end until the submission of the o briain in the 16th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: the norman lordship was weakened by the bruce wars of 1315-1318 the black death of 1349-1350 which disproportionally hit norman controlled towns and besides that english forces were more invested with the hundred years war in france and their own internal conflict the wars of the roses to focus too much on ireland
lines.name: English

lines.value: all of these factors allowed for a 15th-century gaelic resurgence not only in thomond but across a significant part of ireland outside of the pale
lines.name: English

lines.value: brian ban was the last of clann briain ruadh to hold the kingship and from 1350 onwards clann tadhg held sway
lines.name: English

lines.value: mathghamhain maonmhaighe o briain came to power before the death of his uncle diarmuid and he was named as such because he spent time as a foster child in maenmaige
lines.name: English

lines.value: his succession was disputed by his uncle and brother toirdelbhach maol o briain and brian sreamhach o briain
lines.name: English

lines.value: of the two brian sreamhach gained the upper hand and when his uncle tried to enlist the help of the earl of desmond to wrestle back the realm brian thoroughly routed them at croom in a key military success
lines.name: English

lines.value: this had the added benefit of winning back limerick for thomond and sioda cam mac con mara was placed in the city as a warden in 1369
lines.name: English

lines.value: the friendship with the de burghs of galway was maintained by brian and when richard ii was at waterford in 1399 he paid nominal homage and was well received
lines.name: English

lines.value: thomond was now in such a position that conchobhar mac mathghamhna o briain's twenty six year reign was marked as a time of peace and plenty
lines.name: English

lines.value: the years 1426-1459 were marked by a succession of three sons of brian sreamhach reigning tadhg an glemore o briain mathghamhain dall o briain and toirdelbhach bog o briain
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this time mathghamhain dall was deposed by his brother toirdelbhach with the familiar military assistance of the de burghs whom he had formed a marriage alliance with
lines.name: English

lines.value: greater things were to come from the ascent of toirdelbhach's son tadhg an chomhaid o briain
lines.name: English

lines.value: from inchiquin tadhg took advantage of the wars of the roses forming an alliance with the o neill in 1464
lines.name: English

lines.value: he managed to ride south through desmond the rest of the old munster and enforce the cios dubh on the anglo normans
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was a kind of gaelic pizzo which tadgh's great grandfather mathghamhain maonmhaighe had first been able to enforce as a price of protection
lines.name: English

lines.value: his military prowess was such that the earl of desmond was forced to give back to thomond what would later become county limerick
lines.name: English

lines.value: mac fhirbhisigh hints that the men of leinster planned to raise tadhg to the high kingship of ireland before his death and claims he was the greatest o briain since brian boruma himself
lines.name: English

lines.value: thomond was wealthy in the 15th century domhnall mac gormain died 1484 was described as the richest man in ireland in terms of live stock
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the reign of conchobhar na srona o briain thomond maintained alliances with the mac william uachtar of clanricarde and the butlers
lines.name: English
